Content-Type / Accept header validation: No explicit scenarios asserting behavior when Content-Type is missing/incorrect or Accept header mismatches (e.g., non-application/json requests).

Strict schema validation of response: Tests assert "valid Payment object" but there is no explicit assertion coverage for every required field in the Payment/PaymentTransaction schemas, nor versioned schema compatibility checks.

Plugin property / control plugin edge cases: Tests cover multiple plugins/properties but not edge cases for invalid types in pluginProperty, very large numbers of plugin parameters, or conflicting control plugin behaviors (ordering/priorities).
Idempotency tokens & dedup headers: If the API supports idempotency or dedup tokens, no tests exercise those flows.
Rate limiting / throttling: While performance and concurrency tests exist, there are no explicit tests for rate limiting/throttling response behavior (e.g., 429 responses).

Exact Location header validation and follow-up retrieval: Location presence is asserted, but there is no explicit scenario that GETs the Location URL to verify the created resource is retrievable and consistent.
Negative header permutations: Optional header permutations and malformed header values (e.g., extremely long X-Killbill-Reason) are not explicitly tested.
recommendations: Add a scenario to simulate internal server errors (e.g., database outage) that expects 500 and verifies transactional rollback semantics and an adequate error message.

Implement duplicate-submission/idempotency tests: submit the same PaymentTransaction twice and assert the API either returns the same resource (idempotent) or rejects the duplicate with a clear error.
Add tests for invalid paymentMethodId formats and for paymentMethodId belonging to another account to assert correct error codes (400/403) and messages.
Test Content-Type/Accept handling: include scenarios with missing or incorrect Content-Type and malformed JSON (beyond TC09) to ensure proper 415/400 behaviors and clear error messages.
Add strict response schema validation tests that assert required fields and types in the returned Payment object, and include backward/forward schema compatibility checks where relevant.
Expand plugin tests to include invalid pluginProperty types, very large numbers of plugin parameters, and conflicting controlPluginName behaviors to ensure deterministic handling.
If idempotency/dedup tokens are supported by the API, add explicit tests for those headers/behaviors.
Add explicit rate limiting tests that exercise the API until throttling takes effect and assert 429 or documented throttling responses, in addition to performance tests.
Add a follow-up GET of the Location header URL in success scenarios to validate the resource was created and persisted as expected.
Add negative header tests for optional headers with invalid, missing, or overly long values to exercise header validation and error messaging.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/block - Block a bundle

covered_items: Required-success: Happy path for creating a BlockingState (HTTP 201) with required fields (TC01).
Optional inputs: Query params (requestedDate, pluginProperty) and optional headers (Reason, Comment) covered in successful flows (TC02–TC04).
Path parameter validation: Invalid UUID format and non-existent bundleId are tested (TC06, TC07).
Request body validation: Malformed/missing body and invalid date format are tested (TC08, TC10, TC11).
Header validation & auth: Missing required X-Killbill-CreatedBy and invalid auth token tests present (TC09, TC18).
Response verification: Tests assert HTTP status codes and JSON array response with BlockingState objects and field checks (TC01, TC02).
Edge values & limits: Min/max field lengths and large payload tests are present (TC13, TC14, TC16).
Concurrency & resilience: Concurrent requests, retry after transient network error, and service unavailability are covered (TC21, TC22, TC17).
Security: Injection and XSS attempts are included (TC19, TC20).
Integration & consistency: Dependent-service failures and cross-system consistency covered (TC28, TC29).
Regression & compatibility: Special character encoding and backward compatibility scenarios included (TC23, TC24).
Performance: Response-time under normal/peak and resource utilization tests listed (TC25–TC27).
Robustness against unexpected inputs: Extra unexpected parameters behavior is covered (TC12).
gaps: Duplicate submission / idempotency: No explicit scenario for duplicate POSTs (e.g., same payload/resubmission) and how duplicates are handled (dedup token/unique constraints).
Internal server error (500) scenarios: No explicit test that simulates database failures or application 500 errors (distinct from dependent-service 502/503).
Authorization scopes/roles and 403 handling: Tests cover auth token missing/invalid (401) but not role/permission-based authorization resulting in 403.

Exact schema validation variants: While malformed body is covered, there is no explicit coverage for invalid enum values, out-of-range numeric fields, or wrong data types for deeply nested fields in BlockingState beyond "malformed" generic case.
Response header checks: Tests do not assert presence/values of relevant response headers (e.g., Location, Content-Type, or any audit headers).
Duplicate pluginProperty handling: No explicit test for duplicate pluginProperty entries or empty pluginProperty arrays and their semantics.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for client/request rate limiting or server throttling behavior.
Idempotency/transaction semantics under failure: No scenario that verifies whether retrying after partial failure causes double-creation or if transactions are atomic.
Schema evolution error handling: No negative tests for unknown/new fields in request when backward compatibility should be preserved beyond TC12 generic extra params.
recommendations: Add a Duplicate Submission test: send the same BlockingState twice (immediately) and assert deduplication behavior or proper error/200/201 semantics and no duplicate persisted states. Include tests with an idempotency key if supported.
Add 500/Internal Server Error simulations: inject DB failures or simulate unexpected exceptions and assert HTTP 500 and appropriate error body (and that partial writes are rolled back).
Add Authorization/Permission tests: assert 403 responses when an authenticated user lacks permission to block bundles; test roles/scopes if relevant.
Expand schema-negative tests: create focused cases for invalid enum values, out-of-range numeric fields, deeply nested wrong types and ensure descriptive 4xx validation errors.
Assert response headers: include checks for Content-Type, Location (if applicable), and any audit headers returned by the service.
PluginProperty edge-cases: test duplicate pluginProperty entries, empty arrays, and extremely large numbers of pluginProperty items.
Rate limiting and throttling: include tests that hammer the endpoint to ensure proper throttling/rate-limit responses (429) and graceful degradation.
Transaction/idempotency semantics on failures: test partial failure + retry to ensure no double-creation and consistent state across retries (combine with 500 simulation).
Add test to validate exact effectiveDate handling: ensure requestedDate and computed effective date in response follow specified precedence/format rules (explicit timezone/UTC behavior).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache/accounts/{accountId} - Invalidates Caches per account level

covered_items: Valid Deletion: Successful 204 scenario for a valid account (TC01, TC19).
Invalid Account Format: Multiple tests assert 400 for malformed UUIDs (TC03, TC12, TC14, TC15).
Non-Existent Resource: 404 scenarios when account not found (TC02, TC16, TC18).
Authentication: Unauthenticated and expired/invalid-token cases covered (TC05, TC06).
Authorization/Method Handling: Unsupported HTTP method handled (405) is covered (TC11).
Service Unavailability: Dependent cache service and degraded performance cases covered with 503 handling (TC07, TC08).
Query Parameters: Extra/unused query param tolerated (TC09).
Security: Injection/XSS attempts covered (TC14, TC15).
Concurrency/Performance: Concurrent DELETEs and performance target covered (TC13).
Edge / State Variations: No-accounts and partially populated DB states covered (TC16, TC18).
Resilience: Transient network recovery and retry behavior covered (TC17).
Regression/backwards-compatibility: Regression scenarios included (TC12, TC19).
gaps: Authorization role checks (403 Forbidden): No test verifies behavior for an authenticated non-admin user (should be forbidden).
Content-Type / Response Media Type: Acceptance criteria require application/json; tests do not assert Content-Type or response media-type on success/errors.
Idempotency / Repeated Deletes: No test for repeated DELETE on same account (expected semantics: idempotent behavior / consistent status codes).
Soft-delete / DB-state verification: Tests do not verify persistence changes or whether caches are soft-deleted vs physically removed; no DB verification after invalidation.
Server-side error handling (500): No explicit tests for backend failures (e.g., DB outage, unexpected exceptions) returning 500.

Race conditions beyond performance: No tests for race where account is deleted concurrently by another actor (e.g., delete racing with account removal leading to 404/409), or for transactional consistency.
Response Body Schema & Error Codes: Tests check for presence of error messages but do not validate JSON schema, error codes, or structured error fields consistently.
Acceptance Criteria “produces: application/json”: not asserted (success case expects empty body but spec indicates JSON).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for high request rates (429), burst behavior, or throttling.

Cache eviction verification end-to-end: “Caches should be invalidated” is asserted but there are no tests that validate cache-state across dependent services or via endpoints that demonstrate actual cache misses/hits post-invalidation.
recommendations: Add a test for authenticated non-admin user attempting the DELETE to assert 403 Forbidden (authorization enforcement).
Assert Content-Type header (application/json) and validate response JSON schema for error responses and success cases (even if body empty, ensure headers match spec).
Add idempotency test: DELETE same account twice and assert consistent and documented behavior (204 then 404 or 204/204 depending on spec).
Add tests simulating backend failures (DB/cache exceptions) to verify 500 responses and graceful error messages.
Add race-condition tests where an account is being deleted/modified concurrently by another actor to verify safe and consistent behavior (possible 404/409 outcomes).
Implement end-to-end cache verification: after invalidation, call a cache-dependent endpoint or inspect cache service to confirm entries are removed (not just that API responded 204).
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests to validate 429 responses or configured limits under burst load.
Explicitly test the UUID regex boundary cases and maximum-length IDs to ensure server side validation matches the declared pattern.
Standardize and assert structured error responses (fields, codes) so clients can reliably parse failures.
Add a test for unexpected HTTP methods beyond GET (e.g., POST, PUT, PATCH) to ensure consistent 405 behavior and allowed-method headers.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path covered (TC01) verifying 200 + application/json + Tag array and default audit=NONE.
Empty Response: TC06 covers account with no tags returning an empty JSON array.
Query Parameters: includedDeleted (TC02, TC05), audit=FULL (TC03, TC05), audit=MINIMAL (TC04), invalid audit value (TC09), and unknown extra params (TC10) are tested.
Path parameter validation: multiple edge/error cases covered (invalid format TC08, partial UUID TC20, empty TC21, whitespace TC22, max length boundary TC23).
Error scenarios: non-existent account 404 (TC07), invalid accountId 400 (TC08/others), downstream failures 502/503 (TC24/TC11) are present.
Authorization: missing and invalid auth tokens are tested (TC12, TC13) returning 401.
Security/Input validation: injection (TC14) and XSS (TC15) attempts tested and expected to fail.
Performance/scale: large payload (10,000 tags) performance (TC16) and concurrent requests (TC17) are included.
Regression & compatibility: regression test for deleted-tags bug (TC18) and legacy client compatibility (TC19) exist.
Integration/data consistency: TC25 ensures integrated-system updates are reflected.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios validate pagination behavior or limits (offset/limit/page tokens) for large result sets — only a single large-set performance test exists (TC16).
Caching Behavior / Headers: No tests validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET handling (304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit rate-limit or throttling tests (e.g., many rapid requests to trigger 429). TC17 covers concurrency but not rate limit enforcement.
Authorization scope/roles (403): Tests cover 401 (unauthenticated) but not authorization failures (403) for insufficient permissions or role-based access.
Consistent header validation: Content-Type and other response headers are asserted only in TC01; not verified across other scenarios (including error responses).
Schema-level validation of Tag objects: Tests assert "Tag objects" are returned but do not validate Tag object fields, types, required fields, or response schema strictly.
Negative combinations of query parameters: No tests for includedDeleted=false explicitly combined with audit variations (ensure defaults), or boundary boolean values (includedDeleted=false explicit).
Pagination + performance: No tests that combine pagination with performance (e.g., paged responses for very large tag sets).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify offset/limit/page behavior, boundaries, maximum page sizes, and expected metadata (if any). Include a test for retrieving a middle page and last page.

Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify presence and correctness of ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified headers; test conditional requests (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) leading to 304 responses where appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: hammer the endpoint to assert 429 responses when quotas are exceeded and validate Retry-After header semantics.
Add authorization-scope tests: include scenarios where an authenticated user lacks permission and should receive 403, and tests for role-based access control if applicable.

Add strict schema validation for Tag objects across success cases: validate required fields, field types (e.g., tagId, tagDefinitionId, objectType, audit info structure), and that deleted flag or audit details are present/absent per query parameters.
Extend header assertions across scenarios: ensure Content-Type, charset, and error response formats are consistent for success and error cases.
Add tests for query parameter boundary/combinational cases: explicitly test includedDeleted=false, audit omitted vs audit=NONE, and combinations to verify defaulting behavior.
Combine pagination with performance tests: ensure acceptable response times when paging through very large tag lists and confirm server behaves consistently across pages.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/overdue - Retrieve overdue state for account

covered_items: Core acceptance criteria: Successful 200 response and OverdueState JSON schema validation for valid accounts (TC01, TC02).
Error handling for invalid accountId formats and missing accountId: 400 responses (TC04, TC05, TC06, TC16).
Non-existent account handling: 404 responses (TC03, TC13).
Authentication/authorization negative cases: missing and invalid token -> 401 (TC07, TC08).
Server-side errors and dependency failures: 500 (TC09) and degraded dependency handling 503/504 (TC17).
Security input validation: injection and XSS attempts treated as invalid input (TC10, TC11).
Query parameter robustness: extra/unknown query parameters are ignored (TC12).
Performance and scalability checks: single-request performance (TC14), concurrent requests (TC15), large payload handling (TC18), and retry/recovery for transient network errors (TC19).
Regression and backward-compatibility checks: leading/trailing spaces bug (TC16) and response structure consistency (TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests for pagination or list-slicing behavior. (Confirm whether pagination is applicable for this single-resource endpoint; if OverdueState can include lists that should be paged, add tests.)
Caching behavior / conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate limit responses (e.g., 429) or client throttling behavior under excessive requests.
Fine-grained authorization: No tests for permission/role-based access control that could return 403, or for scopes/privileges beyond basic auth token presence/absence.
Content negotiation and headers: No tests for Accept header handling, unsupported media types, or validation of response headers beyond Content-Type.
Schema field-level negative tests: No tests that assert required fields are present/missing in OverdueState or that invalid field values are rejected/handled.

ETL / boundary conditions for very large overdue histories: there is a large payload test (TC18) but no explicit limits/behaviour test when payloads exceed system limits (e.g., truncation, 413 responses).
Rate-limit / burst and retry semantics: while retries are covered in TC19 for network recovery, there is no coverage for client behavior when the service enforces retry-after or backoff headers.
recommendations: Confirm whether pagination is applicable for OverdueState responses. If yes, add tests for page size, page boundaries, and invalid pagination parameters; if not applicable, explicitly mark pagination as N/A in the story to avoid ambiguity.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify presence and correctness of ETag / Cache-Control / Last-Modified headers and that If-None-Match returns 304 when appropriate.
Introduce rate-limiting tests: simulate burst requests and verify 429 responses and Retry-After headers where applicable.
Add authorization role/permission tests that cover 403 Forbidden cases and scope-based access control if the API supports it.
Add content-negotiation tests: requests with different Accept headers and unsupported media types to verify proper 406 or content-type handling.
Add schema-level negative tests: requests/responses missing required OverdueState fields or with invalid field types to ensure strict validation and clear error messaging.
Define and test payload-size limits explicitly: test behavior when the overdue history exceeds configured size limits (expect 413 or defined truncation behavior).
Add tests for conditional retry and backoff semantics: verify how the API exposes retry instructions (Retry-After) and how clients should behave under throttling or partial outages.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts - Retrieve an account by external key

covered_items: Valid Request: Successful retrieval scenarios for the required parameter and all combinations of optional parameters (accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit) are present (TC01-TC05).
Empty Response: Empty/no-data cases are covered (TC06, TC17) returning 404.

Query Parameters: Wide coverage of valid and invalid query parameter combinations including missing required param (TC07), malformed externalKey (TC08), invalid boolean (TC09), invalid audit enum (TC10), extra params ignored (TC16), SQL injection and XSS inputs (TC14, TC15), boundary length tests (TC18, TC19).
Authorization: Authentication negative cases are covered (missing token and invalid token -> 401) (TC11, TC12).
Error Handling / Dependency Failures: Service/unexpected dependency failures and mapping to appropriate codes covered (503 dependency down TC13, 502 inconsistent data TC24, 504 timeout TC25).
Performance: Basic performance tests for normal and peak load are present (response time under normal load TC20, concurrent peak load TC21).
Response Content-Type: At least one scenario checks Content-Type application/json (TC01).
Regression & Compatibility: Regression case for previously problematic externalKey and backward compatibility for legacy clients are included (TC22, TC23).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination. Note: for an endpoint that returns a single resource by externalKey pagination is likely not applicable — clarify in requirements. If the endpoint can return lists in some modes, add pagination tests.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests that exercise rate limits, 429 responses, or Retry-After behavior.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or conditional GET behavior (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified).
Authorization scope / permission errors (403): Tests only cover missing/invalid tokens (401) but not valid tokens with insufficient permissions (403).
Response Schema Validation: Tests assert presence/absence of some fields but do not validate full Account JSON schema, data types, or value correctness for returned fields.
Content Negotiation & Accept header: No tests for unsupported Accept headers (e.g., expecting 406) or variances in Content-Type beyond the single check in TC01.

Rate-limit / abuse under concurrent requests: While there is a peak-load performance test, there is no test asserting the server enforces throttling or returns 429 when limits are exceeded (distinct from performance).
Internationalization / encoding: No tests for unicode/UTF-8 characters in externalKey beyond some special-character cases; non-ASCII keys are not explicitly covered.
recommendations: Clarify whether pagination applies for this endpoint. If it can return more than one account in any mode, add pagination tests (page/offset/limit behavior, large result sets). If it is explicitly single-resource retrieval, mark pagination as N/A in requirements and test plan.
Add rate-limiting tests to verify 429 responses and Retry-After header when request rate exceeds configured limits.
Add caching/conditional-request tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers are present when applicable, and test If-None-Match/304 Not Modified behavior.
Add authorization-scope tests to cover 403 Forbidden (valid token but insufficient privileges) and role-based access checks if applicable.

Introduce strict JSON schema validation tests for the Account response: verify required fields, types (strings, booleans, numbers), and field-level constraints (e.g., email format if present), and include negative schema tests.
Add content negotiation tests: requests with Accept headers for unsupported media types should return appropriate status (e.g., 406), and the API should honor Accept where relevant.
Enhance security tests to include more Unicode / internationalized externalKey values and boundary character sets.
Add tests asserting consistent Content-Type and other relevant response headers across success and error responses (application/json and any error payload conventions).
If rate-limiting or caching behavior is environment/config dependent, provide mocks or test doubles for consistent CI testing.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts - Create account

covered_items: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC11, TC16) verify successful creation with required and optional fields, boundary sizes and partial inputs.
Response Behavior: Success scenarios assert HTTP 201, response body contains Account JSON, and Location header is returned (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC11, TC16, TC20).
Invalid Payload / Validation: Malformed JSON, missing required fields, empty payload and invalid header types are covered (TC05, TC06, TC12, TC08).
Authorization: Unauthorized access is covered (TC09) with expected 401 behavior.
Server/Dependency Errors: Database/unavailable dependency simulated and tested (TC10 -> 503).
Duplicate Handling: Duplicate submission is considered (TC13), at least raising the scenario and expected outcomes (201 or 409 depending on policy).
Security/Input Sanitization: XSS/SQL injection input is included (TC15).
Performance/Concurrency: Concurrent creations and performance behavior are addressed (TC18).
Integration: Post-create retrieval via Location is tested (TC20).
Edge and boundary cases: Large payload (TC11), slow network/timeout (TC14), extra unsupported fields (TC07), unexpected headers (TC17), regression (TC19).
gaps: Schema-level validation: No test explicitly validates that the response body strictly conforms to the Account schema (field-level types, required fields, field formats like email, numeric ranges).
Content-Type & Response Headers: Tests do not assert response Content-Type (application/json) or validate exact Location URL format or presence of other relevant headers (e.g., Content-Length).

Optional header validation: While presence of optional headers is tested in success case, there are no negative tests for invalid types/lengths for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment, nor tests for empty/whitespace-only X-Killbill-CreatedBy values.
Deterministic duplicate behavior: TC13 leaves duplicate handling ambiguous; no deterministic test asserting the system policy (e.g., explicit 409 conflict or idempotent behavior).
Server error spectrum: Only a 503 dependency failure is simulated; no tests for 500 Internal Server Error or other 5xx conditions and how they are surfaced.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate limiting or throttling behavior (guideline for POST rate limiting).
Caching/Idempotency: No tests for idempotency, ETag, Cache-Control, or other caching behavior which may affect creation semantics.

Concurrency race conditions on duplicates: While concurrent creation performance is tested, there is no focused test for race conditions that produce duplicates or partial writes (e.g., two creates for same unique key).
Character encoding and internationalization: No tests for UTF-8/Unicode handling in fields or very large multi-byte inputs beyond generic large payload test.
recommendations: Add schema-validation tests that assert the response body matches the Account JSON schema exactly (field presence, types, formats such as email, phone number, numeric limits).
Assert response headers explicitly: check Content-Type: application/json, exact Location header format (e.g., /1.0/kb/accounts/{id}), and other relevant headers (Content-Length, Date).

Add negative tests for optional headers: invalid types and lengths for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment; test empty or whitespace-only X-Killbill-CreatedBy and confirm it is treated as missing/invalid.

Decide and codify duplicate handling policy and add deterministic tests: if duplicates should return 409, add explicit tests expecting 409; if idempotent, test idempotency keys and repeated submissions returning the same resource/201.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId} - Retrieve a bundle by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Success paths for retrieving a bundle are well covered (default audit, audit=FULL, audit=MINIMAL, audit=NONE).
Path parameter validation: Tests exist for malformed UUID, XSS/injection, and case-sensitivity regression.
Error responses: 400 (invalid id), 404 (not found / empty DB), 503 (service unavailable) are covered per acceptance criteria.
Authorization: Missing and invalid authentication token scenarios (401) are included.
Query Parameters: Supported audit values and unsupported value handling are tested; unknown extra query parameters are covered.
Performance/scale: Large-bundle (size) and acceptable response-time check is present.
Reliability/resilience: Network timeout and transient-error + retry scenarios are included.
Concurrency: Concurrent GET requests are tested.
Accessibility & structure: Backward-compatibility and accessibility (well-structured JSON) scenarios are present.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination/cursor/limit/offset behavior — note: single-resource GET does not normally paginate, so pagination is likely N/A for this endpoint; still listed in guidelines.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers or behavior (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) and conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate-limit responses (e.g., 429) or burst behaviour.
Authorization granularity: No tests for authorization/permission failures that would return 403 (authenticated but not authorized).

Response contract/schema validation: Tests assert that a "valid Bundle object" is returned but do not enumerate required fields, types, or strict schema assertions (field-level validation, nullability, enums inside Bundle).
Content negotiation / headers: No tests for Accept header behavior, or responses when Accept is not application/json.
Negative data integrity: No tests for partially-corrupted bundle data or database-level inconsistencies (e.g., missing associated subscriptions references).
Rate / load stability: No stress tests to validate behaviour when many concurrent requests over time hit the service (beyond a single concurrency scenario).
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers, and conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match => 304).
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate high request rates and assert 429 responses and Retry-After header handling (and client/backoff behavior).

Add explicit schema/contract tests: validate required Bundle fields, types and nested structures (ids, dates, subscription list), and ensure audit payload structure matches expected shape for FULL/MINIMAL.
Add authorization-permission tests: include an authenticated-but-unauthorized scenario expecting 403 to verify RBAC/ACL behavior.
Clarify pagination applicability: if pagination is not applicable for single-resource GET, mark it explicitly in tests/guidelines; otherwise add pagination tests for collection endpoints.
Add content-negotiation tests: request with different Accept headers (e.g., text/plain, */*) and verify correct Content-Type and error handling.
Add corrupted/partial-data tests: simulate DB inconsistencies to verify the API either returns 500 or a well-formed error rather than partial/invalid Bundle objects.
Add more load/stress tests for sustained concurrent usage and verify stability (errors, timeouts, degraded responses).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Retrieve an account emails

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01 (successful retrieval for account with emails) verifies a successful 200 response and JSON content for valid input.
Empty Response: TC02 and TC04 cover accounts with no emails and non-existent-but-valid accountId returning an empty JSON array with 200.
Authorization: TC05 addresses missing/invalid authentication returning 401/403.
Query Parameters (partial): TC07 verifies that extra/unknown query parameters are ignored and do not break the response.
Error handling (partial): TC03 validates invalid accountId format returns 400; TC06 covers service-unavailable (503); security-related error handling is covered by TC10/TC11 (SQLi/XSS).
Large dataset & performance (partial): TC08 and TC13 test behavior with many emails and concurrent requests, exercising scale/performance aspects.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination (page/limit offsets, boundary values, total count, or behavior when paging large datasets).
Caching Behavior: No scenarios validating caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 responses).

Rate Limiting / Throttling: There is no explicit test that triggers rate-limiting responses (e.g., 429) or validates backoff behavior on the server side; TC13 covers concurrency/performance but not server rate-limiting policy.

Detailed Query Parameter Validation: Only an extra-parameter-ignore case is tested; there are no tests for invalid query parameter values, supported query params (if any), or combinations (e.g., filters, sort).

Response Headers & Content Metadata: Aside from Content-Type in TC01, headers such as Cache-Control, Content-Length, ETag, and pagination-related headers (e.g., Link, X-Total-Count) are not validated.
Error Path Coverage for Server Errors: No tests that simulate internal server errors (500) or database failure modes to ensure proper 5xx responses and safe error messages.
Authorization granularity: TC05 checks missing/invalid token, but tests for role/permission-based access (403 vs 401, scope limits) are absent.

Client behavior on transient failures: TC09 describes client retry behavior but does not assert server-side idempotency implications or server retry handling; it is more of a client-level test and lacks specifics (retry policy/timeouts).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios for typical paging (page & limit), boundary conditions (page=0, limit=0, very large page), and verify pagination headers/body (total count, next/prev links).
Add caching tests: validate presence and semantics of ETag/Last-Modified and Cache-Control headers; include conditional GET tests (If-None-Match) expecting 304 when appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many requests to trigger 429 responses and verify Retry-After header and graceful handling.
Expand query-parameter coverage: test valid filter/sort parameters (if supported), invalid parameter formats, and combinations to ensure robust validation and documented behavior.
Cover server error scenarios: add tests that simulate backend failures resulting in 500 responses and ensure responses do not leak internal details and follow the error contract.
Harden authorization tests: add cases for expired tokens, insufficient permissions, and validate 401 vs 403 semantics and error payload consistency.
Augment header and metadata assertions: assert Content-Type consistently across scenarios and verify other critical headers (Cache-Control, Content-Length, ETag, Link/X-Total-Count where applicable).
Clarify and test client retry semantics: specify expected retry policy for transient failures and assert idempotency/safe outcomes; include timeout behavior tests.
Add boundary and encoding tests for response size/limits: beyond "1000+ emails", include tests for maximum payload sizes and verify server response time and memory behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/pagination - List custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC06, TC17, TC18, TC20) validate successful retrieval with default and explicit offset/limit combinations and verify status 200 and returned JSON arrays.
Empty Response: TC07 verifies behaviour when no custom fields exist (empty JSON array with 200).
Pagination: Numerous tests cover pagination mechanics and boundaries (TC02, TC06, TC16, TC20, TC22) including offset/limit combinations, very large datasets, and a regression case for exact counts.

Query Parameters: Parameters are exercised thoroughly — offset/limit positive, zero/negative invalid cases (TC08, TC09, TC10), partial inputs (TC17, TC18), extra unsupported params (TC15), and audit enum values including invalid/auditable injection (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC11, TC14).
Authorization & error handling: Authentication failure (TC12) and service errors/timeouts (TC13, TC19) are present; invalid-parameter error expectations are included (TC08–TC11, TC14).
Concurrency & robustness: TC21 addresses concurrent requests; TC22 covers a regression scenario ensuring pagination correctness.
gaps: Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting (e.g., expecting 429 responses or validating throttling behavior under rapid repeated requests).
Caching Behavior & Conditional Requests: No scenarios verify caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behaviors (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Response Headers and Content Negotiation: Tests do not assert Content-Type, character encoding, or behavior for different Accept headers.

Deterministic Ordering & Stability: Pagination tests assume correct subsets, but there is no test asserting deterministic ordering (sort criteria) across requests or stability when records change between pages.
Authorization granularity: Only missing/invalid token (401) is tested — there are no tests for forbidden access (403) or role-based access controls if applicable.
Precise status-code expectations for invalid inputs: Several error scenarios assert "400 or higher" rather than precise expected status codes and error schemas; this weakens verifiability.
Consistency under concurrent modifications: Concurrent-read tests exist (TC21) but not cases where data is modified while paginated reads occur (race conditions leading to skipped/duplicated items).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid repeated requests to validate 429 responses, Retry-After header presence, and graceful client behavior.
Add caching and conditional request tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers, and test If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since to confirm 304 responses and reduced payloads.
Assert response headers and content negotiation: include checks for Content-Type: application/json; charset, and test Accept header variations.

Add ordering and stability tests: define and test the default sort order for results, verify deterministic pagination across repeated calls, and add tests for behavior when underlying data changes between paginated requests.
Strengthen error expectations: replace "400 or higher" with precise expected status codes and verify error response schema and machine-readable error codes/messages.
Test role-based authorization/403: include scenarios for authenticated but unauthorized users and confirm proper 403 responses where applicable.
Add tests for concurrent modification windows: create/modify/delete custom fields while paginated reads are occurring to validate absence of duplicates/skips or document expected behavior.

Include header/timeouts and SLA tests: verify reasonable response times under normal and heavy load and assert documented timeout behavior, plus tests for graceful failure modes (e.g., database connection errors returning 5xx).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve invoice item audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01 validates successful retrieval (200) and checks AuditLog objects.
Empty Response: TC02 covers an existing item with no audit logs returning an empty JSON array.
Error Scenarios (Not Found / Bad Request / Service Unavailable): TC03 and TC18 cover 404 not found; TC04 and TC17 cover malformed/truncated ID (400); TC08 covers 503 service unavailable.
Authorization (basic): TC05 and TC06 cover missing and invalid authentication resulting in 401 responses.
Query Parameters (unsupported extras): TC07 verifies extra/unsupported query parameters are ignored and do not change the successful response.
Content-Type header: TC16 checks the response Content-Type is application/json.
Security input validation: TC10 and TC11 test SQL injection and XSS attempts and assert no sensitive information is leaked and that payloads are not executed/reflected.
Performance / large payloads: TC09 and TC15 check behavior and response time with very large audit histories and under load.
Concurrency: TC14 covers concurrent requests consistency.
Regression and compatibility: TC12 validates previous bug (missing fields) and TC13 checks backward compatibility for older client headers.
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios target pagination, limit/offset, or maximum page sizes for large result sets.
Caching Behavior / Conditional Requests: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit tests for rate-limit responses (e.g., 429) or server behavior under aggressive request bursts.
Authorization: No tests for authorization scopes/roles (403) or for token scopes/permissions—only 401 is covered.

Schema-level validation: While required fields are asserted generically, there are no explicit tests that validate data types, field formats, nullability, and nested object schemas for AuditLog fields.
Response headers beyond Content-Type: No checks for other important headers (e.g., Content-Length, caching, security headers).
Server error (5xx) coverage is partial: 503 is covered but there are no tests for 500 Internal Server Error or graceful degradation for unexpected server failures.
Query parameter permutations: Only "unsupported extra params" are tested; there are no tests for combinations of allowed query params (if any exist) or malformed query param values.
Payload integrity: No tests for verifying that large responses are not truncated at transport level (beyond TC09 statement) or for streaming/chunked responses.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios for limit/offset/page size, verify correct slicing, total counts (if provided), and behavior at page boundaries (first/last/empty page).
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify presence and semantics of ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control headers and behavior of conditional requests returning 304 where applicable.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts and verify 429 responses, Retry-After header, and that legitimate clients are not unduly throttled.
Expand authorization tests: include role/permission-based access checks that may return 403, test token scopes, and verify audit logs are only visible to authorized principals.
Add strict schema validation tests: assert each AuditLog field type, required/optional presence, nested object shapes, and acceptable value ranges/formats.
Add server-error tests: simulate 500 Internal Server Error and verify the API responds with safe, non-sensitive error messages and appropriate status code.
Validate additional response headers: add assertions for Content-Length, security headers (e.g., Strict-Transport-Security), and any custom headers the API should return.
Test malformed and boundary query parameters: if API accepts query params in future, include malformed values and extreme cases to ensure robust validation.
Add automated tests for transport-level integrity on large payloads: verify complete payload received, no truncation, and correct handling of chunked responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Trigger a payment for all unpaid invoices

covered_items: Valid Request: Core success paths are covered (required only, optional parameters, plugin properties).

Query Parameters & Validation: paymentMethodId, externalPayment, paymentAmount, targetDate and pluginProperty are validated with positive and negative tests (malformed, invalid types, negative/zero amounts).
Headers: X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence and emptiness are tested; optional headers (Reason, Comment) are exercised in success scenarios.
Account state variations: accounts with unpaid invoices, no unpaid invoices, and no invoices are covered.
Boundary payment behaviors: partial payments, exact balance payments, over-payment prevention are covered.
Error handling: malformed accountId and non-existent accountId map to 404; authentication missing (401) and invalid payment method (400/404) are covered.
Dependency failures & server errors: payment gateway, plugin system and database unavailability are included (502/503/500 flows).
Security: SQL injection in accountId and XSS in pluginProperty are included.
Duplicate/retry & idempotency-related regression: retry/network timeout scenarios and prevention of duplicate payments are covered.
Edge cases & limits: extremely large paymentAmount and large pluginProperty array are present as edge-case scenarios.
Integration / performance / non-functional: performance under normal and peak load, stress resource-utilization, and API documentation accessibility are included.
gaps: Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for handling many requests in a short time (429, throttling behavior).
Concurrent race conditions beyond retry: No explicit test for simultaneous requests from different clients causing double-charge or race on invoices (concurrency/locking behaviour).
No-default-payment-method behaviour: Missing a scenario where paymentMethodId is omitted and the account has no default payment method (expected error behavior not tested).
Authorization scope / insufficient permission (403): Tests cover missing/invalid auth (401) but not an authenticated user lacking permission (403).
Response headers and body schema assertions: Tests do not assert response headers (Content-Type, caching, ETag) or the (absence of) response body for 204, nor consistent error payload schema/fields.
Payment method ownership/authorization: No test for using a paymentMethodId that exists but belongs to a different account.
Precision/currency edge cases: No explicit checks for currency mismatches, rounding/precision issues for paymentAmount, or limits on decimal precision.
Idempotency tokens / dedup headers: No tests for idempotency header behavior (if supported) to prevent duplicates beyond retry flows.
Validation permutations: Combination/interaction tests of multiple invalid query params together (e.g., malformed targetDate + invalid externalPayment) are absent.
Rate-limiting and DoS resiliency: separate from simple rate limiting—tests for long sustained high request rates and graceful degradation are not present.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests (burst requests, 429 behavior, Retry-After header) and a test matrix for exponential backoff behavior if applicable.
Add concurrency tests that trigger multiple simultaneous POSTs for the same account to validate locking/idempotency and ensure no double-charge under high concurrency.
Add a scenario where no default payment method exists and paymentMethodId is omitted; assert the expected error (400/404/422) and a clear error message.
Add an authorization test for an authenticated user lacking permission to perform payments (expect 403).
Assert response headers and error payload schema consistently across success and failure cases (Content-Type, relevant audit headers, and structured error fields).
Add tests for paymentMethod ownership (attempt to use a payment method belonging to another account) to ensure proper authorization checks.
Add tests for currency/precision edge cases: huge decimal values, rounding behavior, and currency mismatch handling.

If the API supports idempotency, add tests for idempotency tokens and longer retry windows to prove no duplicates are created; otherwise add a test confirming recommended client behaviour and server safeguards.
Add combinatorial negative tests that send multiple invalid parameters together to validate how the API aggregates/returns validation errors.
Include long-duration / sustained-load tests for resiliency and DoS-like patterns (beyond short peak-load tests).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/search/{searchKey} - Search bundles

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path and many valid query-parameter combinations (offset/limit, audit) are covered (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).
Empty Response: Empty-result cases are tested (TC06, TC24) and pagination edge cases that return empty arrays (TC07, TC08).
Pagination: Offset/limit behavior, limit=0, offset greater than total, very large offsets/limits and large-data performance are present (TC02, TC07, TC08, TC19, TC26).
Query Parameters: Valid and invalid values for offset, limit and audit are exercised, including extra/unexpected parameters (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC11, TC12, TC18).
Authorization: Missing and invalid authentication token scenarios are included (TC13, TC14).
Error handling: Client errors (malformed searchKey, invalid params), server errors, dependency failures and timeouts are covered (TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC15, TC16, TC25).
Security: Injection attempt is explicitly tested (TC17).
Performance & Concurrency: High-volume and concurrent-request scenarios are present (TC19, TC20).
Behavioral/regression checks: Backward compatibility and partial-db population scenarios are present (TC21, TC23).
gaps: Default parameter behavior: There is no explicit assertion that omitted optional query parameters use the documented defaults (offset default 0, limit default 100, audit default NONE). TC01 implicitly covers “no query params” but does not validate limit/offset/audit default values or that results are truncated to the default limit.

Bundle schema / field-level validation: Tests do not validate the Bundle object structure or required fields against the API definition (field types, required fields, nested audit fields beyond presence).
Caching behavior: No scenarios checking caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or behavior for conditional GETs.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate limiting responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under burst traffic aside from concurrent correctness.
Authorization nuance: No tests for forbidden access (403) or role-based access control if applicable (only unauthenticated/invalid token -> 401 are covered).

Response headers and content-negotiation: Apart from one check for application/json (TC01), there are no assertions for other relevant headers (Content-Length, pagination-related headers if any) or behavior when Accept header differs.

Negative/edge numeric bounds: No tests for upper bound validation when service enforces maximum allowable limit smaller than client-specified value (e.g., attempting limit > service max resulting in 4xx or forced truncation).
Internationalization / encoding: No tests validating handling of unicode/URL-encoded searchKey or path-encoding edge cases (although malformed and injection cases exist).

Storage-consistency race conditions: While concurrency correctness is checked for read consistency, there are no tests for simultaneous write operations affecting search results (if relevant for consistency guarantees).
recommendations: Add explicit tests asserting documented default parameter behavior: verify offset defaults to 0, limit defaults to 100, and audit defaults to NONE when omitted; confirm result count respects the default limit.
Add schema-level assertions for Bundle objects: validate required fields, types, nested audit details (when audit=FULL/MINIMAL/NONE), and that malformed/missing fields are not present or flagged.
Introduce caching tests: check for ETag / Cache-Control / Last-Modified headers and conditional GET behavior (304 responses) to verify caching semantics.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts or repeated requests to verify 429 or backoff behavior and document acceptable limits.
Cover authorization nuances: include tests for 403 forbidden (role/permission-based failures) if the API has RBAC or scope differences, and test token expiry scenarios.
Test response headers and content-negotiation more comprehensively: verify Content-Type, Content-Length, any pagination headers, and behavior when Accept header requests other media types.
Add tests for upper-bound numeric validation: attempts to request limits beyond service-enforced maximum should be exercised and expectations documented (error vs truncation).
Add encoding/URL-encoding tests for searchKey: verify unicode, percent-encoding, and long-path handling to ensure robust path param parsing.
If relevant, add tests that combine reads with concurrent writes to exercise data-consistency guarantees for search during mutations.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles - Retrieve a bundle by external key

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy-path success (TC01) verifying 200 and JSON array with the matching Bundle.

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of externalKey, includedDeleted (true/false), audit (FULL/MINIMAL/NONE), invalid values, missing parameter and empty parameter (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC09, TC10, TC29).
Empty Response / Not Found: Non-existent key and empty DB scenarios covered (TC08, TC16).
Authorization: Unauthorized and forbidden responses covered (TC11, TC12).
Error Handling: 404 for not found, 400 for invalid/missing params, 503 for service/db outages (TC06, TC07, TC08, TC13, TC28).
Audit and Response Schema: Audit levels and presence/absence of audit fields covered (TC03–TC05); required Bundle fields presence covered (TC30).
Soft-delete behavior: includedDeleted true/false and deleted-flag behavior covered (TC02, TC06).
Edge cases & robustness: Duplicate-results, very large DB, max/min length, non-ASCII, null bytes, unexpected input format covered (TC14, TC23, TC24, TC25, TC26, TC27).
Security: SQL injection and XSS handling tests present (TC19, TC20).
Performance & resilience: Response time SLA, concurrency, transient network recovery and retry behavior covered (TC17, TC18, TC21).
Compatibility & regression: Backward compatibility and regression for non-ASCII keys covered (TC22, TC23).
Content-Type check: Response Content-Type validated in happy path (TC01).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination or limit/offset behavior (or verifying API does not unexpectedly paginate results).
Caching / Conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or If-None-Match / 304 behavior.
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limit responses (e.g., 429) or throttling under high request rate.
Default parameter behavior: No explicit test asserting default values when optional parameters are omitted (e.g., audit defaults to NONE, includedDeleted defaults to false).
HTTP 5xx semantics: 500 Internal Server Error and other intermediate server error codes are not explicitly tested (only 503 is covered).
Header & content negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling or behavior when client requests non-JSON or different Accept values.
Response header validation: Apart from Content-Type, other headers (Cache-Control, Date, Retry-After when 503, ETag) are not validated.
Rate/Load-related stability: While concurrency is tested functionally, there is no load-test style coverage for sustained high throughput or burst behaviour tied to rate-limiting.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios that verify behavior when multiple pages would be required (limit/offset or page parameters), and confirm that for a matching externalKey the API returns all matching items or documents lack of pagination as expected.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: validate presence/semantics of ETag and Cache-Control headers and behavior of If-None-Match (expect 304 where appropriate).
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests and verify 429 responses or documented throttling behaviour and Retry-After header handling.
Add explicit tests for default parameter behavior: verify that omitting audit yields NONE and omitting includedDeleted yields false (and corresponding response variations).
Add tests for 500/Internal server errors and graceful degradation: simulate application-level failures that should return 500 and ensure no sensitive information is leaked.
Add Accept header/content negotiation tests and broader response-header assertions (Cache-Control, Date, ETag, Retry-After for 503/429).
Add longer-running load/stress tests to validate stability under sustained high request rates and observe behavior related to rate limiting and resource exhaustion.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple successful scenarios (TC01–TC04, TC17) verify 204 responses and DB updates for valid payloads and header combinations.
Required and optional headers: Tests validate presence of required X-Killbill-CreatedBy and behavior when optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are provided (TC01, TC02, TC07).
Path parameter validation: Invalid UUID format and non-existent resource tests cover 400 and 404 acceptance criteria (TC05, TC06).
Request body validation: Missing body, malformed JSON, invalid CustomField objects and schema validation are covered (TC08, TC09, TC10).
Authentication/Authorization: Unauthorized token test covers 401 handling (TC11).
Server errors: System/database failure test covers 500 handling (TC12).
Integration/consistency: Subsequent GET verification after update is covered (TC17).
Edge cases and limits: Large number of custom fields, very large payload, and maximum value length tests are present (TC14, TC15, TC20).
Concurrency and performance: Multiple concurrent requests and performance-related checks are included (TC19, TC20).
Security: Injection attempt test is included to validate input sanitization/validation (TC13).
Duplicate handling/regression: Duplicate custom field names test included (TC18).
Extra properties: Handling unexpected properties in the request body is covered (TC16).
gaps: Content-Type / Accept headers: No explicit tests validate required Content-Type: application/json, handling of unsupported media types (415), or Accept header behavior.
Response content-type and error schema: Tests do not assert that error responses (400/404/401/500) produce application/json or follow a documented error schema.
Partial update semantics: No explicit test to verify whether partial CustomField objects/partial fields are allowed or rejected (PUT semantics).
Idempotency / Duplicate submission: No tests for duplicate/ repeated identical requests (idempotency) and how duplicate submissions are handled.
Header validation for optional headers: No tests for invalid values/lengths for X-Killbill-Reason or X-Killbill-Comment, nor behavior if they exceed allowed lengths.
Exact status code expectations for security/validation: Some scenarios (e.g., injection) accept multiple possible codes (400 or 422) — need deterministic expected behavior asserted.
Authorization scopes / permissions: No test for forbidden (403) when an authenticated user lacks permission (role-based access).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests to verify behavior under heavy request rates (rate limits, 429 responses).
Caching / ETag / conditional requests: No tests covering caching headers or conditional update semantics (e.g., If-Match/ETag) even if not typical for PUT.

Schema-level detail for CustomField: Tests don’t exhaustively validate individual field constraints (e.g., allowed characters for field name/namespace, max lengths for individual attributes beyond value length).
recommendations: Add tests that send requests with and without Content-Type: application/json and assert 415 responses for unsupported media types and correct handling when Content-Type is correct.
Assert response Content-Type and error response structure for 4xx/5xx cases to ensure API produces application/json error payloads matching a schema.
Add explicit test(s) for partial update attempts (e.g., CustomField objects missing required properties) to verify PUT semantics (reject or accept) and make expected status code deterministic.
Add idempotency/duplicate submission tests that send the same payload twice to verify behavior (no duplicate entries or well-defined duplicate handling).
Create tests for validation of optional headers (X-Killbill-Reason, X-Killbill-Comment) including max length, invalid characters and expected responses.
Standardize expected status codes for input validation/security scenarios (choose 400 vs 422) and update tests to assert the precise code and error message to avoid ambiguity.
Add authorization permission tests that exercise 403 Forbidden for authenticated users without the required privileges, not only 401 unauthenticated cases.
Introduce rate limiting/throttling tests (burst of requests) to verify the system returns 429 or otherwise throttles and degrades gracefully under load.
If applicable, add conditional request tests (ETag / If-Match) or explicitly document that they are not supported; otherwise add tests to assert their absence/behavior.
Expand schema validation tests for CustomField to exercise name/namespace/value constraints (allowed characters, reserved names, min/max lengths) beyond just max value length.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Retrieve payment custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC16) verify successful retrieval with default and explicit audit levels (NONE, MINIMAL, FULL).
Empty Response: TC04 and TC19 cover the case where a payment has no custom fields and the API should return an empty JSON array (including regression case).
Query Parameters: Good coverage for audit query param (valid values FULL, MINIMAL, NONE and invalid value TC25). There is also test coverage for ignored extra query params (TC05).
Authorization: Authentication error cases are covered (TC08 - missing token, TC09 - invalid token returning 401).

Input Validation / Error Handling: PaymentId format validation and malformed inputs covered (TC06 invalid format, TC13 SQL injection, TC14 XSS, TC20 trailing spaces, TC21 special characters). Non-existent resource handled (TC07) and empty DB state (TC22).
Dependency & Service Errors: Dependent-service and service-unavailable scenarios are present (TC17 -> 502, TC10 -> 503).
Performance / Scale: Large payload handling (TC11 with 1000 items), response-time threshold (TC12), concurrency under load (TC24), and retry after transient failure (TC15) are covered.
Data consistency & regression: Adds/visibility of newly added custom fields covered (TC18) and a regression case for previously-causing-500 covered (TC19).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination or limit/offset behavior for very large result sets (e.g., verify page/size params or server-side paging behaviour). TC11 exercises volume but does not validate paging semantics.
Caching Behavior / Conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrency is tested (TC24), there are no explicit tests for rate-limiting responses (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests) or throttling behavior.
Authorization granularity: 401 scenarios are present, but there are no tests for authorization/permission errors that would return 403 (if endpoint has role-based access rules).
Response Headers & Content-Type: No explicit tests validating Content-Type, charset, or other important response headers.
Schema / Field-level Validation: Tests assert JSON array presence/size but do not validate the schema of CustomField objects (required fields, types, nullable constraints, or unexpected fields).
Generic 500 Server Error: Aside from specific regression and dependency errors, there is no explicit test for internal server errors (500) when an unexpected server-side error occurs.
Pagination performance boundaries & streaming: No tests for streaming/pagination performance when results exceed memory/transfer limits.
Accept header / Content negotiation: No tests for Accept header handling (e.g., non-JSON Accept leading to 406 or correct content negotiation).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify behavior when result sets are large and the API supports/should support pagination. Test limit/offset/page params (or document absence) and boundary cases (page 0, negative, beyond last page).
Add caching / conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control presence and behavior; test If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified is returned where appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate a burst of requests to validate 429 responses or the configured throttling behavior; include retry-after header checks.
Add authorization/permission tests: if business rules restrict access, include tests for 403 forbidden (valid token but insufficient permissions).

Validate response headers and schema: assert Content-Type: application/json, and validate each CustomField object (field names, types, presence/absence of audit fields depending on audit param). Use JSON schema or explicit checks.
Add 500 server error scenario: simulate a server-side failure (e.g., DB exception) and assert API returns a sensible 500 with diagnostic-safe error message.
Extend large-results testing to include pagination/streaming behavior: validate performance and correctness when results grow beyond single-response assumptions.
Add Accept header and content-negotiation tests: ensure the API responds correctly to different Accept header values (including unsupported types).
Clarify and test authorization/roles if applicable: if some clients should not access payment custom fields, add tests to reflect role-based access limitations.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/catalog - Delete all versions for a per tenant catalog

covered_items: Valid Deletion: Successful deletion scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC05, TC15) verify 204 responses and that catalog versions are removed or empty.
Required Header Validation: Missing required header scenarios (TC03, TC14) validate server rejects requests without X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Authentication/Authorization (basic): Invalid token scenario (TC04) checks unauthorized access (401).
Optional Headers: Presence and use of optional headers (X-Killbill-Reason, X-Killbill-Comment) are exercised (TC02).
Non-Existent Resource: Deleting for a non-existent tenant is covered (TC06) with expected 404.
Error Handling: System/internal error simulation (database down) covered (TC09) resulting in 500.
Concurrency: Concurrent deletion behavior tested (TC13) to check consistency and responses for competing requests.
Performance/Scale: Large dataset deletion/performance is included (TC10) to validate acceptable response times.
Security/Input Validation: Injection/malicious header payloads are tested (TC11) to validate rejection of unsafe header values.
Regression/Integrity: Orphaned references regression test (TC12) checks that related data is removed.
Unexpected/Extra Headers: Handling of extra unsupported headers is tested (TC08).
Malformed Header Values: Empty/invalid header value scenario covered (TC07).
gaps: Soft-delete vs Permanent-delete semantics: No explicit tests assert whether deletion is a hard delete or a soft delete (e.g., tombstone flag, recoverability, audit trail).
Authorization scope/permissions (403): Tests cover invalid/expired token (401) but do not cover authenticated-but-unauthorized users (RBAC) resulting in 403.
Idempotency / repeated deletes: While concurrency is tested, explicit idempotency expectations for repeated sequential DELETE calls (first 204, subsequent 204 vs 404 vs 410) are not asserted.
Audit / telemetry validation: No tests verify audit records, change history, or that X-Killbill-* headers are logged/recorded.
Exact response body content & error payloads: Tests assert status codes but do not validate standardized error response bodies/fields (error codes, messages, debug info).

DB-level verification beyond existence: While "deleted" checks are present, there are no tests verifying referential integrity at DB level (checks for cascades, FK constraints, or deleted timestamps), or verifying backups/snapshots unaffected.
HTTP method safety / method-not-allowed: No tests confirm other HTTP methods (GET/POST/PUT) are rejected with 405 for this endpoint.
Header boundary/encoding tests: No tests cover header length limits, non-ASCII characters, or encoding edge-cases beyond injection.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for API rate-limits / burst behavior relevant to delete requests.
Detailed concurrency conflicts: TC13 allows multiple outcomes; there is no strict contract asserted for what concurrent clients should reliably receive (e.g., first 204 then 404).
recommendations: Add explicit soft-delete vs hard-delete tests: verify whether records are permanently removed, or marked deleted (check DB fields, recovery paths, and expected retention policy).
Add RBAC/permission tests that exercise authenticated-but-unauthorized users and expect 403 responses (different roles/scopes).
Add idempotency tests: call DELETE repeatedly in sequence and assert the documented behavior for repeat deletes (204, 404, or 410 as defined).
Add audit/logging verification: assert that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded in audit logs or change history, and that deletion events are emitted if applicable.
Validate error payload schema: for 4xx/5xx responses assert the structure and content of error bodies (error codes, messages) to ensure consistent client behavior.
Add HTTP method validation tests: verify that unsupported methods on /1.0/kb/catalog return 405 Method Not Allowed and appropriate Allow header.
Add header boundary and encoding tests: long header values, non-ASCII/UTF-8 characters, and header size limits to ensure robust validation.

Add more precise concurrency contracts: create deterministic tests that assert which response codes are expected for concurrent calls (and verify no race-condition corrupts state), including DB-level checks after concurrent operations.
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests if the API enforces such limits, to verify behavior under bursts and ensure DELETE operations are protected from abuse.
Add DB-level integrity verification: after deletion, run queries to ensure no orphan rows, FK violations, or unexpected side-effects remain; include backup/restore considerations if relevant.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Add custom fields to bundle

covered_items: Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC19) validate successful creation with required and optional headers and variants (no prior fields, existing fields, extra query params).
Path & Header Validation: Tests for invalid bundleId format (TC05), non-existent bundle (TC06), missing required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy (TC07), and optional headers behaviour (TC02, TC19).

Request Body Validation: Malformed JSON (TC08), empty body (TC09), empty array (TC18), schema validation/missing required fields (TC10), unsupported additional fields (TC12), duplicate field names in payload (TC11), and large payload handling (TC17) are covered.
Error Responses: Expected HTTP codes for 201/400/404/401/503 are covered in relevant scenarios (TC01, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC14, TC15, TC20).
Resilience and Performance: Network timeout and retry behavior (TC16), concurrent requests/performance (TC22), and dependent-service unavailability (TC20) are included.
Security: SQL injection and XSS input attempts are explicitly tested (TC23, TC24).
Regression/Edge Cases: Field name casing/regression test (TC21) and duplicate-name detection (TC11) are present.
Integration/Docs Accessibility: Accessibility of API documentation is included (TC25).
gaps: Server-side error simulation (500 Internal Server Error) and database failure scenarios are not present — tests include 503 but not 500 server errors.
Duplicate submission/idempotency across repeated identical requests is not covered (e.g., retrying same request causing duplicate resources or dedup behavior).
Authorization beyond missing/invalid token: no tests for valid token but insufficient permissions (403 Forbidden).
Content-Type and Accept header handling: no tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., not application/json) or response Content-Type and other HTTP headers (e.g., Location, ETag).
Payload-too-large / 413 handling when limits are exceeded is not explicitly tested (only 'approaching system limits' happy-path).
Explicit validation of individual field data types and boundary values (e.g., max length, numeric ranges) is limited — TC10 covers schema errors but not granular field-level limits.
Duplicate submission at transport level (idempotency keys) and how the API prevents double-creates on retries is missing.
Behavior/response body contract checks beyond high-level (e.g., exact response schema, timestamps, IDs returned, ordering) are not asserted except in TC01 which checks match to payload.
403/permission model, rate limiting, and throttling tests are absent.
Server response headers and caching behavior are not checked (though caching is less relevant for POST, some headers like Location or Retry-After could be important).
recommendations: Add a test simulating a 500 Internal Server Error (database or unexpected server exception) and assert proper 5xx handling and safe error messages.
Add duplicate-submission/idempotency tests: send the same payload twice (with and without idempotency token) and assert whether duplicates are prevented or handled gracefully.
Add authorization tests for insufficient privileges (valid token but missing scope/roles) expecting 403 Forbidden.

Add tests for Content-Type/Accept headers: missing or incorrect Content-Type (expect 400), and verify response Content-Type is application/json and presence of useful headers (e.g., Location if applicable).
Add an explicit test for payloads exceeding size limits (expect 413 or appropriate error) and validate server behavior when very large payloads exceed quotas.
Expand schema/validation tests to cover field-level boundaries (max length, numeric ranges, allowed value sets) and invalid data types per CustomField definition.
Add tests for idempotency/duplicate submission prevention at API level (e.g., Idempotency-Key header or dedupe rules) and verify audit/logging behavior if required.
Add assertions for response body contract (presence and format of ids, createdBy, createdDate, object ordering if relevant) beyond mere presence of objects — ensure fields returned match spec.
Include rate-limiting/throttling tests and retry/backoff behavior when limits are hit, and a 429 expected response if applicable.
If applicable, verify server returns helpful Retry-After headers for 503/429 and that client retry behavior is within policy; add tests for these headers.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/product - Retrieve product for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC19) validate successful retrieval with subscriptionId and/or requestedDate and check 200 responses and Product body.
Empty Response / No Data: TC11 covers the empty-database scenario and verifies a 404/no product response is handled.
Query Parameters: A wide variety of parameter combinations are exercised — both-present, only-subscriptionId, only-requestedDate, no-params, extra params (TC01–TC04, TC14).
Input Validation & Error Paths: Invalid date format (TC06), invalid UUID (TC08), nonexistent subscription (TC05) are covered with expected 4xx responses.
Authorization: Unauthorized access is explicitly tested (TC09) to ensure auth errors are returned.
Service/Dependency Failures: Service unavailable (TC10) and downstream dependency failure (TC21) are present (502/503 handling).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempts are covered (TC16, TC17) to check input sanitization and error messages.
Edge & Boundary Cases: Future date, date before subscription start, and boundary-date regression are covered (TC12, TC13, TC18).
Performance & Load: Concurrency and performance acceptance scenarios are present (TC15, TC20) to validate throughput/response times at a high level.
Integration & Consistency: TC22 asserts that returned Product matches catalog definition; response Content-Type is checked in TC01; product schema validation is present in Background.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests for pagination or for endpoints returning multiple products with page/limit parameters — guideline explicitly calls out pagination for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behavior (304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests that validate rate limiting responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under rapid repeated requests — TC15 is concurrency/load but not rate-limiting-specific.

Explicit Error Payload Schema: Tests assert presence of error messages but do not validate the error response schema or content structure consistently (e.g., error codes, error types, correlation ids).

Ambiguous/Multiple Result Behavior: TC03/TC04 mention "200 or appropriate error if ambiguous" but do not assert a single expected behavior — no deterministic test for how multiple-matching subscriptions are handled or whether the endpoint is allowed to return multiple products.
Caching/Content Negotiation headers & Accept header handling: Only Content-Type is checked once; tests do not exercise Accept header negotiation or response header correctness beyond Content-Type.
Authorization granularity: No tests for 403 (forbidden) vs 401, or role-based access control if applicable.
Pagination-related performance: No tests combine pagination with performance/load to validate behavior on large datasets.
Error status variations: While many 4xx/5xx cases are present, there is no explicit test coverage for 422 vs 400 semantics beyond suggestions in security scenarios.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: create scenarios where multiple products/subscriptions exist and assert page/limit/offset behavior and response metadata (total, page, size).
Add caching/conditional GET tests: validate ETag/Cache-Control/Last-Modified headers, and test conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) resulting in 304 where appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid repeated requests and assert 429 responses and Retry-After header handling.
Define and validate error response schema: add assertions that error payloads follow a consistent JSON schema (fields like code, message, details, timestamp, correlationId).

Clarify and make deterministic behavior for ambiguous/no-param cases: replace "200 or appropriate error" with a single expected behavior and add tests asserting it; if multiple products can be returned, add tests for multi-item responses and pagination.
Add Accept header and content negotiation tests: verify the service responds correctly to different Accept headers and returns proper Content-Type and charset.
Add explicit authorization scope tests: include 403 scenarios for authenticated but unauthorized callers and test role-based access if relevant.
Add tests that validate caching headers combined with performance/load to ensure correctness under scale.
Add negative tests for large or malformed query param payloads (very long strings, extremely old/future dates) and assert consistent error handling.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Upload the full catalog as XML

covered_items: Core acceptance criteria around successful creation are covered: multiple scenarios assert 201 responses and that a new catalog version becomes available (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC13).
Required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy is tested for presence, emptiness and missing-case error handling (TC01, TC02, TC06, TC07).

XML payload correctness is exercised: well-formed, malformed, empty, whitespace-only, partial/corrupted, minimal, boundary values, comments/CDATA, unicode/special characters, different encodings, and very large payloads (TC01, TC08, TC09, TC12, TC13, TC17, TC18, TC23, TC24, TC28, TC29, TC30).
