results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered_items: Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios (single and multiple tags, existing/no-existing tags) are well covered (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC05).
Required/Optional Headers: Presence and omission of the required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header and optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are tested (TC03, TC06).
Invalid Payloads: Malformed JSON, empty array, invalid tag-definition UUIDs, unsupported extra fields, and null/empty elements are covered (TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC24).
Duplicate Handling: Duplicate tag-definition IDs in a single request and adding an already-existing tag on the invoice item are covered (TC13, TC20).
Resource Not Found / Bad ID Format: Non-existent invoice item (404) and invalid invoice-item-id format (400) are covered (TC07, TC08).
Authorization / Auth Missing: Unauthorized access case is covered (TC16).
Large Payload / Performance: Very large payload behavior and a performance under load scenario are present (TC14, TC19).
Dependency and Service Errors: Service unavailability and dependent service failure scenarios are present (TC17, TC21).
Edge Conditions: Database-empty state, maximum-tags limit, timeout/long-running operations, and malicious payload scenarios are included (TC15, TC23, TC25, TC18).
gaps: Server Internal Errors (500): No explicit test for generic internal server error / DB failure producing 500 responses.
Partial-success / Atomicity: No test for mixed-valid/invalid tag-definition IDs in the same request to confirm whether operation is atomic or partial (transaction behavior).
Schema-Level Response Validation: Tests assert tagDefinitionIds but do not validate the full Tag object schema (fields, types, timestamps, createdBy, tag-id UUID format, content-type header).
Idempotency / Concurrency: No concurrency tests that exercise race conditions or simultaneous requests adding the same tag to ensure no duplicate creation under race.
Authorization Granularity (403): No test for authenticated but unauthorized users or role-based access control (403).
Content-Type and Headers: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type, or for presence/validation of response headers (e.g., Location, Content-Type).
Partial network error handling: No tests for transient network errors/retries or intermediate errors (e.g., 502, 504 covered but not retries/backoff behavior).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting behavior (429) or server throttling under burst traffic.
Response Validation for Large Success: For large payloads that succeed (TC19), there is no explicit verification of correct count, ordering, or completeness beyond "contains all created tags".
Caching / POST-specific headers: While caching is primarily GET-related, there is no verification of any relevant headers after POST (e.g., cache invalidation signals).
recommendations: Add a test that simulates a server-side failure (database exception) and expects a 500 Internal Server Error to validate server error handling.
Add a test where the request body contains a mix of valid and invalid tag-definition UUIDs to verify atomic vs. partial success semantics and expected rollback behavior.
Validate the full Tag object schema in success responses: id UUID format, tagDefinitionId, objectType, createdBy, createdDate, and verify Content-Type response header is application/json.
Add concurrency tests that issue parallel POSTs to add the same tag(s) to the same invoice item to ensure no duplicate tags are created and to detect race conditions.
Include role-based authorization tests to assert 403 responses for authenticated but unauthorized users and test different user permissions.

Add tests for missing or incorrect Content-Type request header and verify server returns appropriate errors (415/400); also validate important response headers (Location, Content-Type, caching headers if applicable).
Add rate-limiting/burst tests to verify 429 behavior or graceful throttling under high request rate.
For very large successful payloads, add explicit assertions about the number of Tag objects returned and spot-check fields to ensure completeness; for 413 responses, assert the error message format.
Add tests for retry/backoff behaviors or transient network errors where applicable, and include checks for meaningful error messages and monitoring-friendly responses.
If the service exposes any limits (e.g., max tags per invoice item), add tests to assert precise limit values and boundary conditions (e.g., one below, exact, one above).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/pagination - List bundles

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple successful retrieval scenarios (default params, explicit offset/limit, audit levels) are present (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).
Empty Response: Responses for no-data and offset-beyond-data are covered (TC06, TC07).
Pagination: Basic pagination behavior, offsets, limits, large dataset slices and boundary large-value checks are covered (TC02, TC05, TC07, TC16, TC17, TC18).

Query Parameters: Good coverage of parameter combinations and invalid values (negative offset/limit, invalid audit values, extra unexpected params, SQL-injection style input) (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC14, TC15, TC16).
Authorization: Unauthorized access test is present (TC12).
Error Handling / Dependency Failures: Database unavailability and timeout cases covered (TC13, TC22).
Performance & Load: Response-time/performance tests under normal and peak load and concurrent requests are included (TC17, TC18).
Security: Simple injection attempt is tested to validate input sanitization (TC14).
Regression / Backwards Compatibility: Regression scenarios for audit param and omission are included (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests assert caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Schema Validation: Tests assert "JSON array of Bundle objects" but do not validate the Bundle object schema/required fields, types, or nested structures against the definition.
Content-Type & Headers: No assertions for response Content-Type, charset, or other response headers (e.g., pagination-related headers if any).

Exact Status Codes & API Contract: Some error scenarios accept multiple possible status codes (400 or 422, 503 or 504) — there are no strict tests asserting the exact code required by the API contract (this may leave ambiguity).

Rate Limiting vs Concurrency: While peak/concurrent load is tested (TC18), there are no explicit tests for throttling behavior and rate-limiting responses (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests) or verifying retry headers.
Authorization nuance: There is a test for missing/invalid token (401) but no tests for insufficient permissions (403) or role-based access controls, if applicable.
Parameter type validation: Malformed non-numeric values for numeric params (e.g., offset=abc, limit=ten) are not explicitly tested (SQL injection is covered but generic type validation is not).
Boundary conditions not fully covered: limit=0, limit=1, offset exactly equal to total count, and exact maximum allowed limit boundary tests are missing.
recommendations: Add caching/header tests: assert presence and correctness of Cache-Control and ETag headers, and add conditional GET tests (If-None-Match / 304) to validate caching behavior.
Add strict schema validation tests: validate each returned Bundle against the API schema (required fields, types, nested objects) and assert Content-Type: application/json.
Tighten status-code expectations: add tests that assert the exact status codes defined by the API contract for each error case (or document and assert permitted alternatives explicitly).
Add explicit rate-limiting tests: simulate burst traffic to confirm throttling occurs correctly (429 responses, Retry-After header), and measure behavior under sustained high request rates.
Add parameter type/format negative tests: send non-numeric strings for offset/limit and assert 400/422 responses.
Add permission/authorization tests beyond missing token: test valid token with insufficient permissions (expect 403) if the API supports role-based access control.
Add boundary tests: limit=0, limit=1, offset equal to total items, limit exactly equal to maximum allowed — and assert behavior and returned counts precisely.
Add deterministic tests for default parameter behavior: explicitly assert default offset=0 and default limit=100 when parameters are omitted, including when dataset size equals the default limit.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache - Invalidates the given Cache if specified, otherwise invalidates all caches

covered_items: Valid Deletion: TC01, TC02 and TC08 verify successful invalidation of all caches, a specific cache, and when no caches exist (204).
Non-Existent Resource: TC03 verifies behavior and 400 response when cacheName does not exist.
Invalid/Not-Alive Resource: TC04 covers cache present but not alive -> 400.
Query Parameter Handling: TC01, TC02, TC05, TC09 cover absence of cacheName, valid cacheName, empty cacheName, and unsupported extra parameters.
Input Validation: TC10, TC11, TC15 and TC05 cover very large values, special characters, previously problematic formats, and empty values.
Authorization (negative): TC06 verifies unauthenticated/invalid token returns 401/403 and prevents invalidation.
Server Error Handling: TC07 simulates cache subsystem failure and expects 500.
Concurrency & Performance: TC13 and TC14 exercise large-scale invalidation and concurrent requests.
Case Sensitivity: TC12 validates behavior when cache names differ in case.
Response Body Expectations: Multiple scenarios assert 204 + empty response body for successful operations.
gaps: Content-Type / "Produces: application/json": Acceptance criteria state the endpoint produces application/json; tests assert empty bodies for 204 but do not assert Content-Type or response headers.
Authenticated-but-not-admin (authorization role): TC06 covers unauthenticated/invalid token but does not explicitly test an authenticated user without admin privileges (should produce 403).
Idempotency / repeated deletes: No test verifying repeated DELETEs against the same cache (e.g., second delete should be safe / expected status behavior).
HTTP method handling: No tests for invalid HTTP methods (e.g., GET/POST on this endpoint) returning 405.
Rate limiting / throttling: Standard guideline asks to verify multiple requests in short time; TC14 tests concurrency but not rate limiting or throttling policies.
Error response schema and headers: Tests assert the presence of an error message but do not validate error response structure, codes, or Content-Type for error responses.

Atomicity / partial invalidation side-effects under concurrent operations: TC14 checks stability and 204 responses, but there is no explicit verification that no unintended caches are invalidated or partial state remains under race conditions.
recommendations: Add assertions for relevant response headers (Content-Type: application/json) for both success and error responses to satisfy "Produces: application/json".
Add a test for an authenticated non-admin user to ensure proper role-based authorization (explicitly assert 403).
Add an idempotency test: delete the same cache twice and assert expected status (e.g., first 204, second either 204 or a defined idempotent response) and no adverse effects.
Add tests for invalid HTTP methods (e.g., GET/POST) to ensure the endpoint rejects them with 405 Method Not Allowed.
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests (many rapid requests from same client) to ensure server handles/exposes rate limits gracefully.
Add validation of error response schema and headers (structure, error codes, error fields, Content-Type) to make tests robust and machine-checkable.

Enhance concurrency tests to assert atomicity/side-effects: verify that concurrent invalidations do not partially invalidate unrelated caches and that cache states after concurrent operations are consistent.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allTags - Retrieve account tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios validate successful retrieval (default, filtered by objectType, combinations of parameters).
Empty Response: Scenario for an account with no tags (TC07) ensures correct empty-array handling.
Query Parameters: Good coverage for objectType, includedDeleted, and audit (valid values and invalid audit value - TC22), unsupported params (TC13), and combinations (TC06, TC20, TC21).
Authorization: Missing/invalid token scenario (TC10) checks unauthorized access (401).

Error Handling: Invalid accountId (malformed UUID - TC09 -> 400), non-existent account (TC08 -> 404), downstream unavailable (TC11 -> 503), timeout (TC15 -> 504), and database-empty state (TC25) are covered.
Deleted Tags / Soft Delete: includedDeleted behavior covered (TC03, TC16, TC19) and soft-deleted account scenario (TC26) is present.
Audit Levels: NONE/MINIMAL/FULL cases covered (TC01/TC05/TC04), including combinations with includedDeleted (TC06, TC21).
Integration: Adding and deleting tags via other APIs then verifying GET is covered (TC18, TC19).
Performance / Concurrency: Large dataset performance (TC14) and concurrent requests (TC23) are included.
Security Input Validation: SQL injection attempt tested (TC12).
Content-Type header: Presence of application/json verified (TC27).
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Regression case for deleted-tags bug and backward-compatibility default behavior are present (TC16, TC17).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination or explicit confirmation that pagination is not supported (e.g., page/limit, or handling very large responses in pages).
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or conditional requests (ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control, Last-Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests that simulate exceeding rate limits and asserting 429 responses or throttling behavior.
Authorization depth: Tests cover 401 (missing/invalid token) but not 403 (forbidden) or role-based access controls / scoped permissions.
HTTP 500 / generic server errors: While 503/504 are present, there is no explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error behavior and how error payloads are returned.

Response Schema/Field-level Validation: While Tag schema conformance is asserted in TC01, there are no explicit negative tests for malformed Tag fields returned from downstream services or versioned schema changes.
Pagination-like behavior for very large payloads: TC14 checks performance but not streaming, chunked responses, or server behaviour when payloads exceed limits.
Rate limiting and caching interactions with concurrency: Combined scenarios (concurrency + caching/ETag/rate limits) are not covered.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests or an explicit test to assert the API does not support pagination. If pagination is supported or may be in future, add tests for page/limit/offset, boundary pages, and malformed pagination parameters.
Add caching/conditional-request tests: check ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match to get 304, and verify Last-Modified behavior (or assert these headers are intentionally absent).
Add rate-limiting tests that simulate many requests in a short window and validate 429 responses and Retry-After semantics (or assert that rate limiting is not applied).

Expand authorization tests: add 403 scenarios (valid token but insufficient permissions or role), test scoped tokens and behavior for different roles, and verify error payloads do not leak sensitive info.
Cover generic 500 Internal Server Error handling: simulate server-side exceptions and verify consistent 500 responses and safe error messages.
Extend schema validation: add tests that assert required Tag fields, types, and enum values are present and validate behavior when downstream returns unexpected field shapes.
For large datasets, add tests verifying server behavior when response size approaches limits (streaming/chunking), and test client timeouts vs server-side pagination decisions.
Add combined stress tests: concurrency plus rate-limit/caching to observe interactions and ensure consistent behavior and correct headers/logging.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/renameKey - Update a bundle externalKey

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy path (TC01) verifies success (204) and DB persistence of externalKey.
Required Header Validation: TC02 verifies missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy leads to 400.
Path Param Validation: TC03 checks malformed bundleId format; TC04 and TC15 verify non-existent bundle handling (404).
Request Body Validation: TC06 (missing body), TC07 (malformed JSON), TC08 (missing externalKey) cover common body errors producing 4xx.
Uniqueness Constraint: TC05 covers conflict when externalKey already used for the same account.
Optional Headers: TC14 verifies X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are handled in a happy path.
Edge Cases & Input Validation: TC09 (extra fields), TC10 (very long key), TC11 (empty key), TC19 (special characters), TC20 (leading/trailing spaces) explore input validation limits.
Authentication/Authorization: TC12 covers missing/invalid auth returning 401/403.
Service/Error Handling: TC13 covers dependency/unavailable service (503).
Concurrency: TC17 addresses concurrent update behavior/race conditions.
Performance/Non‑functional: TC16 and TC23 include payload and response-time checks.
Regression & Compatibility: TC18 (regression), TC22 (legacy clients) are included.
Misc: TC21 checks tolerance for unexpected headers; TC24 covers API documentation accessibility.
gaps: Account scoping for uniqueness: No explicit test that the same externalKey is allowed across different accounts (uniqueness is per-account in the story).
Content-Type/Accept handling: No scenarios verify missing or incorrect Content-Type or Accept headers and their resulting status codes.

Produced Content-Type & Response Body on errors/success: Tests assert status codes but do not consistently assert Content-Type header or the exact JSON error schema (story states produces application/json).

Full Bundle Schema: The story references a Bundle object; tests assume only externalKey is relevant. There is no test for validating the full Bundle schema if the API expects other required fields or rejects extra/unknown fields beyond the extra-field happy path.
Idempotency / Repeat Requests: No test for repeated identical rename requests (idempotency) or duplicate submissions.

Exact Error Codes and Messages: Several scenarios accept multiple possible codes (e.g., TC10/T19/T20 allow 204 or 400). The story specifies 400 for invalid arguments; tests do not assert exact error messages or error code mapping consistently.
Cross-field validation: No tests for interactions between headers and body (e.g., CreatedBy required and its value format), or for audit logging/metadata persistence tied to headers.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting behavior.
Pagination / Caching: Not applicable to this endpoint but caching/ETag behavior is not covered (if relevant).
Database constraint & rollback semantics: No tests verify transactional behavior (partial failures rollback), or that failed rename leaves bundle unchanged.
recommendations: Add tests that verify externalKey uniqueness is scoped per account: try renaming to a key used in a different account and expect success.
Add tests for Content-Type and Accept handling: missing Content-Type, wrong Content-Type, missing Accept, and assert returned Content-Type (story says produces application/json) and error schema.
Create assertions for the error response JSON schema and exact messages/codes for 400/404/503 to avoid ambiguity in diagnoses and automation.
Add idempotency/duplicate submission tests: repeated same request should be safe (or explicitly defined) and observed behaviour should be asserted.
Add tests to validate the full Bundle schema if the API expects more fields (or assert that only externalKey is required and other fields are ignored).
Add tests to verify transactional behavior: e.g., simulate dependent-service failure after validation to confirm no partial state change.
Add a test for verifying that X-Killbill-CreatedBy value format is validated (if any) and that audit metadata is recorded appropriately.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests if the API is subject to rate limits.
Tighten ambiguous tests: replace OR-style assertions (204 or 400) with explicit expected behavior after implementation is finalized, so CI can enforce precise behavior.
Add a test to verify same-key rename in different account contexts (positive) and same-account conflict (already covered) to ensure correct scoping.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Retrieve bundle tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (no params, audit=FULL, audit=MINIMAL, includedDeleted=true, combinations) verify 200 responses and response body type.
Empty Response: Scenario for bundles with no tags verifies empty JSON array handling.
Query Parameters: Good coverage of audit and includedDeleted usage, unsupported audit value, extra/unexpected params, and injection attempts.
Error Scenarios: Invalid bundleId format (400) and non-existent bundle (404) are covered.
Authorization: Missing and invalid token cases (401) are included.
Reliability/Error Handling: API unavailable and slow dependency scenarios (503/504 or timeouts) are covered.
Performance/Scale: Tests for very large tag sets, concurrent requests, and resource utilization are present.
Regression: Specific regressions around deleted tags and backward compatibility (no audit param) are tested.
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination, limits, offset/page params or behaviour with very large datasets (e.g., ensuring paging or explicit "no pagination" behaviour).
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: No checks for caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behaviour.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for API rate limit responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under throttling.
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden / role/permission-based access scenarios are not covered (only 401 auth failures are tested).
Query param validation coverage: invalid values for includedDeleted (non-boolean) and boundary cases for audit (e.g., lowercase "full"/"minimal", repeated params) are missing.
Response schema / field-level validation: Tests assert "Tag objects" at a high level but do not validate required fields, types, or audit sub-structure in detail (beyond FULL/MINIMAL presence).
Content negotiation and headers: No tests for Accept header variations or verifying Content-Type negotiation other than one Content-Type check.
Error payload consistency: No assertions validating error response schema/structure for 4xx/5xx responses.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify behaviour when many tags exist (page size, offsets, next/prev links, limit defaults) and test boundary conditions (page 0, page beyond last).
Add caching/conditional GET tests: validate ETag and Cache-Control headers, conditional requests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) and expected 304 responses or cache invalidation behaviour.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts to assert 429 responses or proper throttling headers and retry-after semantics.
Add authorization-permission tests: include 403 scenarios for authenticated but unauthorized clients and tests for role-based access if applicable.
Expand query-param validation tests: include invalid includedDeleted values (e.g., "yes", "1", "abc"), case sensitivity checks for audit enum, duplicate params and long/malformed query strings.
Add strict response-schema tests: validate each Tag object fields (ids, names, audit sub-objects), types, required/optional fields and examples for FULL/MINIMAL/NONE audit detail.
Validate error response schemas: assert consistent error code, message, and structure for 400/401/403/404/429/500 style responses.
Add content-negotiation tests: verify behavior with Accept: application/xml, missing Accept header, and explicit Content-Type checks across responses.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/plan - Retrieve plan for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: multiple success scenarios cover requests with subscriptionId+requestedDate, only subscriptionId, only requestedDate, and neither parameter (TC01-TC04).
Query Parameters: many combinations of valid, missing and invalid parameters are tested (TC01-TC08, TC13-TC14).
Invalid Input Handling: malformed UUID and malformed date cases are covered (TC05, TC06, TC08).
Not Found / Resource Absence: non-existent subscriptionId scenario is covered (TC07) and empty-database behavior is addressed (TC11).
Error Handling for Dependencies: service-unavailable and system-error scenarios are present (TC10, TC12).
Authentication: unauthorized access is tested (TC09).
Security: SQL injection and XSS attempt cases are included (TC17, TC18).
Edge / Boundary Cases: requestedDate on boundary and overlapping-plan data integrity are covered (TC12, TC13).
Performance & Regression: response-time under normal and concurrent load and regression/back-compatibility tests are included (TC15, TC16, TC19, TC20).
Response Semantics: the test suite acknowledges acceptable alternative behaviors for ambiguous cases (e.g., default plan vs empty object) which maps to the story’s note that parameters are optional.
gaps: Pagination: no tests cover pagination or handling of large result sets (e.g., page, limit, next links).
Caching Behavior: no tests assert caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: no tests for rate-limiting behavior or 429 responses under aggressive request patterns (TC16 measures latency but not rate-limit handling).

Strict Content-Type and Schema Validation: tests assert "valid JSON Plan object" but do not assert Content-Type header or validate the Plan JSON against the documented schema (field-level assertions are missing).
Authorization nuance: only 401 is covered; no tests for 403 (forbidden) or role-based access restrictions where applicable.

Ambiguous expected behavior coverage: scenarios that currently allow "200 or default" are imprecise — the acceptance criteria should be explicit and tests should assert a single expected behavior (e.g., whether omitting both params returns default, empty, or error).
Response header checks: no assertions for response headers (Content-Type, caching, pagination headers).
Large payload / large dataset performance: performance scenarios exist but no tests for behaviour with very large catalogs or many subscriptions (memory/timeout concerns).

Error message consistency and codes: tests accept multiple possible codes in many cases (e.g., 409 or 500 for data integrity). The API contract should be strict and tests should assert exact codes/messages.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create a large number of plans/subscriptions and verify pagination query parameters, page sizes, next/prev links, and behavior at dataset boundaries.
Add caching tests: assert presence and correctness of Cache-Control and ETag headers and test conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match returns 304 when appropriate).
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate rapid requests to verify throttling behavior and correct 429 responses and Retry-After header handling.

Tighten and codify expected behavior for optional parameters: update acceptance criteria to specify the single expected response when parameters are omitted or when requestedDate has no matching plan; then update tests to assert that exact behavior (200 with default plan, 404, or empty object).
Add schema-level validation: validate response Content-Type is application/json and validate the Plan object against the canonical JSON schema (check required fields, types, and example values).
Add header assertions: check Content-Type, caching, and any pagination headers in success and error responses.
Cover authorization variants: add tests for 403 (insufficient permissions) and tests for different authenticated roles if applicable.

Make error-code expectations precise: choose and enforce single expected status codes for ambiguous cases (e.g., overlapping plans should map to one agreed code such as 409) and assert error payload structure and messages.
Extend large-dataset and performance tests: include tests combining large datasets with concurrent requests to look for timeouts, OOM, or degraded behavior (in addition to simple latency checks).

Add negative functional tests for edge situations not explicitly covered: requestedDate outside any plan period for an existing subscription (assert exact expected behavior), and subscription exists but plan deleted/soft-deleted.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered_items: Valid Request (PUT -> 204): TC01 covers the primary success path for putting a host back into rotation and verifies system state change.
Idempotency / Already-in-rotation: TC02 verifies PUT is idempotent (204) when host is already in rotation.
Authentication & Authorization: TC03 (401), TC04 (403) and TC09 (missing auth headers -> 401) cover auth/permission failure modes.
Method validation: TC06 checks invalid HTTP method (GET) returns 405.
Service unavailability / dependency failure: TC05 covers endpoint/service down (503).
Unexpected payloads / header tolerance: TC07 and TC08 exercise non-empty bodies and extra headers and expect graceful handling.
Concurrency & race conditions: TC14 covers concurrent PUTs and checks for race conditions and consistent final state.
Resilience & retries: TC13 covers transient network interruption and retry behavior.
Performance under load / timeout behavior: TC10 addresses high load / acceptable timeout and correct response under degraded performance.
Security: TC12 checks for injection attempt in headers (at least the presence of a test for security handling).
Regression test presence: TC11 captures a previously fixed bug scenario and ensures expected behavior remains.
gaps: Produces / Response headers (application/json): The story states "Produces: application/json" but no scenario asserts response Content-Type or other relevant headers for successful or error responses. 204 responses are asserted to be empty but the media-type requirement is not verified.

Exact error-range coverage: Story requires responding with HTTP >=400 on errors; tests include 401/403/405/503 but do not explicitly cover 400 (Bad Request), 409/422 (if applicable), or 500 (internal server error) scenarios such as server-side exceptions or DB failures.

Validation semantics for request body: Request Body = N/A in the story but TC07 accepts non-empty payloads and expects 204. The story does not define whether non-empty payloads should be ignored or rejected — missing explicit test that validates the intended handling policy.

Non-existing resource / host context: The PUT operates on “the host” (no host id). Tests assume at least one host exists (Background). There is no test for behaviour when there are zero applicable hosts or if the host context cannot be determined.

HTTP semantics for 204 with body: Tests assert empty response body for 204 but do not assert that no body is present or handle clients that misinterpret 204 with a Content-Type — subtle RFC semantics not tested.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate-limiting behavior (requests in rapid succession leading to 429 responses).
Caching behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) even though standard guidelines mention caching for endpoints.
Detailed concurrency conflict handling: TC14 tests concurrency success, but there is no test for contention leading to transient conflict responses (e.g., 409) or for internal locks/timeouts.

Detailed input validation errors: Although the endpoint expects no body, there is no test that tries malformed headers/invalid auth token formats or checks error payload structure/content except generic messages.
recommendations: Add assertions for response headers (Content-Type: application/json) and presence/absence of body for 204 responses to match "Produces: application/json" in the story. Clarify and test the expected Content-Type behavior for 204 responses.

Add error-path tests for server-side failures (500 Internal Server Error) and for explicit 400-class errors (400 Bad Request, 422/409 if applicable) to ensure the system responds with HTTP >=400 as required by the acceptance criteria.

Define and test the expected handling of non-empty request bodies: either explicitly accept/ignore non-empty payloads (and assert that) or reject them with a 4xx status. Make the policy explicit in the story and cover it with tests.
Add a scenario where no host is available / host context cannot be determined, to assert a defined error or no-op behavior (e.g., 404 or 204 + log), depending on product decision.
Add rate-limiting tests (rapid repeated requests) to validate 429 behavior or other throttling mechanisms, and include tests that combine rate limiting with authentication to validate precedence.
Add tests for caching-related headers if the API is expected to include them; otherwise explicitly document that caching is not applicable so tests can be omitted.
Add negative concurrency tests that simulate contention/failure under lock and assert a deterministic error response or retry behavior (e.g., temporary 409 or exponential backoff).

Strengthen security tests: verify that injection attempts do not change state and that error responses do not leak sensitive information; assert specific error message formats for auth failures and service errors.
Add assertions on the structure/content of error responses (consistent error JSON schema) for 4xx/5xx so clients can reliably parse failures.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC06) validate successful retrieval with combinations of query parameters (accountId, includedDeleted, audit).
Empty Response: TC05 verifies behavior when no tags exist (empty JSON array).

Query Parameters: Many permutations are covered — valid/invalid formats, missing required accountId (TC11), includedDeleted true/invalid (TC02, TC13), audit values FULL/MINIMAL/invalid (TC03, TC04, TC14), extra unexpected parameter (TC15).
Error handling for resource existence and format: Invalid UUID formats (TC07, TC08), non-existent resources (TC09, TC10), and state variations (TC26, TC27) are present.
Authorization: Missing/invalid token case is covered (TC12) returning 401.
Robustness / resilience: Backend service unavailable (TC18) and downstream audit logging availability (TC24, TC25) are tested.
Security: Injection and XSS style tests are included (TC19, TC20) to check for information leakage and input sanitization.
Performance & scale: Performance under normal and peak loads are included (TC21, TC22).
Regression & integration: Regression for deleted-tags visibility (TC23) and integration with audit logging (TC24, TC25) are covered.
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination or handling of large datasets (page size, offsets/limits, next/prev links) are present — critical for GET endpoints returning arrays.
Caching Behavior / Conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting leading to 429 responses or server behavior under abusive rapid requests (distinct from performance latency tests).

Authorization granularity: Only missing/invalid token (401) is tested. There is no test for forbidden access (403) or scope/permission checks (e.g., valid token but not allowed to view this account/invoice item).
Response headers and content-type: No assertions for HTTP response headers (Content-Type application/json, caching headers, pagination headers).

Boundary correctness for UUIDs: TC16/TC17 refer to "max/min allowed UUID length" — UUIDs have fixed length; the edge-case intent is unclear, and there are no explicit tests for malformed-but-length-correct UUIDs or other boundary encodings.

Conditional error coverage: No tests for 500 Internal Server Error (generic server errors) other than the specific backend-unavailable 503 scenario; no tests verifying error payload schemas/consistency.
Large payload handling: No tests that assert behavior when the number of tags is very large (response size limits, streaming/pagination fallback).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios with large numbers of tags and verify limit/offset or page-based responses, next/prev links, and correct slicing of results.
Add caching and conditional-get tests: verify presence and correctness of ETag/Cache-Control headers, and behavior for If-None-Match returning 304 where applicable.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many rapid requests to assert 429 responses and verify headers (Retry-After) and graceful degradation.
Expand authorization tests: include forbidden (403) scenarios where token is valid but lacks permission for the requested account/invoiceItem, and tests for cross-account access attempts.
Validate response headers and content type consistently across success and error cases (Content-Type, Cache-Control, pagination-related headers).

Clarify and correct UUID boundary tests: replace ambiguous min/max length cases with well-defined tests: properly formatted but non-existent UUIDs (already present), and malformed UUIDs (covered), and encoding edge-cases if relevant.
Add generic server-error tests: simulate 500 Internal Server Error to ensure consistent error responses and non-leakage of internals.
Add large-response and streaming behavior tests: verify client and server behavior for very large arrays of tags (memory, truncation, timeouts) and ensure pagination or streaming is used.
Add tests asserting response schema for error bodies (consistent error model) and content for 4xx/5xx cases.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/search/{searchKey} - Search accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Happy-path scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC18) validate successful searches and combinations of query parameters.
Empty Response: TC04 and TC05 validate behavior when no matching accounts or an empty database return an empty JSON array with 200.
Query Parameters (valid): TC02 and TC03 exercise offset, limit, accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, and audit values including FULL and MINIMAL.
Query Parameters (invalid): TC06, TC07, and TC08 cover malformed search key, negative/non-integer pagination, invalid booleans, and invalid audit enum values returning 4xx.
Authorization: TC09 and TC10 cover missing and invalid tokens (401 responses).
Error / availability: TC11 and TC16 test service-unavailable and timeout behavior (503/504), and TC19 covers dependent-service failures (502/503).
Security: TC12 and TC13 explicitly test SQL injection and XSS attempts and assert safe failure modes (400/422) and database safety.
Pagination + Large volume: TC03 and TC15 cover pagination behavior and a large-data/performance scenario including concurrency.
Regression & backward compatibility: TC17 and TC18 cover empty searchKey regression and backward compatibility for clients using only path param.
Accessibility / payload clarity: TC20 addresses response payload structure and descriptive field names for assistive tech.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching-related response headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET handling.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although TC15 includes concurrency, there are no tests for rate-limiting responses (e.g., 429) or throttling behavior under burst loads.

Schema / Field-level Validation: Tests assert presence/absence of high-level fields (balance, CBA, audit) but do not validate the Account object structure against a schema (field types, required fields, formats).

Pagination edge cases: Missing tests for boundary conditions such as offset beyond result set, limit=0, extremely large limit values, default behavior when params omitted (explicit verification of defaults), and paging consistency across repeated requests.
Content-Type and Response Headers: No assertions on Content-Type (application/json), character encoding, or other operational headers (Cache-Control, Content-Length, Connection).
Authorization variations: No tests for forbidden (403) scenarios (e.g., valid token but insufficient scope/permissions).

Path-encoding & URL-escaping: While malformed characters are tested, there is no explicit test for proper URL-encoding/decoding of reserved characters in the path (encoded vs raw), or behavior with UTF-8/multibyte characters.

Mutual parameter interactions / precedence: It’s unclear whether accountWithBalance and accountWithBalanceAndCBA are mutually exclusive or how they interact in edge cases; tests do not assert precedence, duplication handling, or error on conflicting params.
recommendations: Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control and behavior for conditional GETs (304) and ensure cache headers are appropriate for this resource.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst traffic and verify 429 responses or backoff behavior and document limits; include tests that assert retry-after header semantics if applicable.
Add schema validation tests: validate each returned Account object against the API's Account schema (field presence, types, formats), not just presence/absence of balance/CBA/audit.

Expand pagination edge-case coverage: tests for offset beyond available results (should return empty array), limit=0, extremely large limit values, default values when params omitted, and verify paging is stable across repeated paged requests.
Assert response headers and content-type: include checks for Content-Type: application/json, charset, cache-related headers, and any custom headers (correlation-id, rate limit headers, etc.).
Add authorization scope/permission tests: include scenarios where token is valid but lacks permissions and assert 403 behavior.
Add URL encoding / internationalization tests: exercise UTF-8 multibyte search keys and properly URL-encoded reserved characters to ensure correct server handling.

Clarify and test parameter precedence/constraints: add tests documenting expected behavior when accountWithBalance and accountWithBalanceAndCBA are both provided, and validate any mutually exclusive or overriding rules.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered_items: Valid Request: Success cases for latest catalog and combinations of requestedDate and accountId are covered (TC01-TC04).
Empty Response / No Data: Scenarios for no catalog (TC05) and an empty catalog with no products/plans (TC15) are present.

Query Parameters & Input Validation: Various combinations of query params are tested including valid requestedDate/accountId, invalid formats, extra unsupported params, maximum lengths and injection attempts (TC02-TC04, TC07-TC08, TC09, TC13, TC16).
Authorization & Permissions: Unauthorized and forbidden access cases are covered (TC10, TC11).
Error Handling: Error scenarios for no match (TC06), service unavailable (TC12), timeout (TC22), and general malformed XML regression (TC19) are present.
Performance & Concurrency: Large-catalog performance, concurrent requests, peak-load and transient network recovery are included (TC17, TC18, TC21, TC14).
Schema / Compatibility: Backward compatibility and well-formed XML/schema conformance checks are specified (TC19, TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No test covers pagination or partial retrieval behaviour for large result sets (GET guideline: Pagination).
Caching Behavior: No scenarios verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control), conditional requests (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since) or 304 Not Modified responses.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests validate rate limiting behavior or server responses when request rates exceed limits.
Content Negotiation & Head requests: No tests for Accept header variations (e.g., application/xml) or support for HEAD requests and their headers.
Response Headers & Encoding: Missing checks for important headers (Content-Length, Content-Encoding, charset) and compression behavior (gzip).
Precise Error Code Expectations: Several scenarios accept either 400 or 404 for "no catalog" — the tests don’t assert a single canonical code; this ambiguity can mask incorrect implementations.
Boundary & Negative Performance: While performance is mentioned, there are no clear stress test boundaries, systematic SLA assertions, or monitoring of resource usage (memory/CPU).
Rate-limit / DoS resilience: Related to security, there are no tests covering abusive traffic patterns beyond concurrency/performance tests.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (if the API supports or may support pagination) — verify behavior for page size, offsets, and large datasets; include tests for correct total counts and links/metadata.
Add caching/conditional request tests: assert ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match and If-Modified-Since returning 304 when appropriate, and validate client caching semantics.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: simulate bursts to validate 429 responses and Retry-After header handling.
Add tests for Accept header negotiation and HEAD requests: verify the API responds appropriately to Accept: application/xml, Accept: text/xml, and that HEAD returns correct headers without body.
Add assertions for response headers and encoding: Content-Length, charset (e.g., UTF-8), Content-Encoding (gzip) and behavior for compressed responses.
Tighten error-code expectations: decide and assert canonical error codes for "no catalog" vs "bad request" cases to avoid ambiguous acceptance tests.
Expand performance tests with clear SLAs and resource metrics: include stress tests that ramp to peak load, measure percentile response times, and check for 5xx error rates and resource exhaustion.
Include security/load abuse tests: repeated malicious requests, slowloris-like patterns and verify the service remains stable and responds within defined limits.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/block/{blockingId}/auditLogsWithHistory - Retrieve blocking state audit logs with history by id

covered_items: Valid Request: TC01 and TC19 validate successful retrieval and JSON schema/content-type for a valid blockingId.
Empty/No-Data Responses: TC02 and TC17 cover cases where no audit logs or no blocking states exist (empty array / 404).
Error Handling (Not Found / Invalid ID / Format): TC03 and TC04 cover non-existent IDs and malformed UUIDs, producing 404/400 as applicable.
Authorization: TC05 and TC06 cover missing and invalid authentication scenarios (401).
Server/Infrastructure Errors and Timeouts: TC07 and TC20 cover service-unavailable and gateway-timeout behaviors (503/504).
Large Dataset & Performance: TC09 and TC16 exercise large history and concurrent requests, including a performance expectation (response time).
Security: TC11 and TC12 include SQL injection and XSS payload checks ensuring inputs are rejected and no sensitive leakage occurs.
Query Parameters / Robustness: TC08 verifies that unexpected query parameters are ignored and do not break the response.
Regression & Compatibility: TC14 and TC15 cover regression scenarios and legacy client headers compatibility.
gaps: Pagination: No scenario verifies pagination behavior, page size limits, next/prev links or partial responses for very large result sets (TC09 expects "all entries" but does not assert pagination semantics).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: There are no tests for rate limiting, 429 responses, or how bursts of requests are handled under throttling rules (relevant to GET and performance).
Caching Behavior & HTTP Cache Headers: No tests check ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified, or conditional GET behavior (304 responses).
Detailed Authorization Variants: 403 (forbidden) and role/permission-based access control are not covered — tests only assert 401 for auth failures.
500/Internal Server Error handling: There is no explicit test asserting behavior or messaging for 500 responses when the server/backend fails (only 503/504 are covered).
Pagination + Performance Interaction: TC09 asserts response time but does not check behavior when automatic pagination is expected (e.g., server-side limits causing multiple pages).
Input validation edge cases beyond UUID format: length limits, unexpected unicode, and header-driven content negotiation (e.g., Accept header leading to 406) are not present.
Rate-limit related concurrency: TC16 tests concurrent successful requests but does not assert system behavior under overload or when limits are reached (e.g., some requests returning 429).
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: request with limit/offset (or page/size) parameters, assert correct slice of results, presence/format of pagination metadata, and behavior when requesting pages beyond last page.
Add rate limiting/throttling tests: generate bursts of requests to assert 429 responses are returned appropriately and that retry-after headers are present when applicable.
Add caching/conditional-get tests: assert presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers; test conditional GETs that return 304 when appropriate.
Expand authorization tests: include scenarios that exercise 403 Forbidden (insufficient permissions or role-based denial) and tests for different user roles if applicable.
Add a 500 (internal server error) test: simulate backend/database failure to verify the API returns a 500 with a non-sensitive error message and consistent error schema.

Clarify and test pagination vs “return all” for large datasets: if the API should paginate, change TC09 to assert pagination and iterate pages; if it returns all, assert memory/timeout behavior explicitly.
Add content negotiation tests: vary Accept headers (e.g., unsupported media type) and assert correct 406 or fallback behavior.
Add rate-limit + concurrency stress tests that assert system behavior under sustained load and ensure tests capture degraded responses (timeouts, 429) and recovery behavior.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/priceList - Retrieve priceList for a given subscription and date

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple success scenarios (both params, only subscriptionId, only requestedDate, no params) cover expected successful GET behavior and content-type checks.
Empty Response / No Data: TC13 explicitly covers behavior when the DB has no subscriptions or price lists (404 or empty/default response).
Query Parameters: Wide range of combinations are tested — valid, omitted, malformed, partially provided, extra unexpected parameters, size limits.
Error Handling: Common error cases are covered (400 for invalid formats, 404 for not-found, 401 unauthorized, 503 service unavailable, 502 dependency failure).
Security input validation: Injection (TC10) and XSS (TC22) attempts are included to verify the system does not expose internal details or execute payloads.
Performance / Resilience: Response time under normal and peak load (TC14, TC15), retry after transient network failure (TC17), large data volume (TC18) are present.
Regression / Edge cases: Date boundary behavior (TC21) is explicitly included.
Response correctness: Success scenarios assert the response is a valid PriceList JSON object and content-type application/json.
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination behavior (page/limit/offset) or the API's behavior when the underlying data set is large with respect to paging. TC18 checks large volume performance but not pagination semantics.
Caching Behavior / Conditional GET: There are no tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests that verify rate-limiting behavior, 429 responses, or Retry-After headers under abusive request rates.

Authorization completeness: TC08 covers missing/invalid token (401) but there is no test for authorization failures that should return 403 (valid auth but insufficient permissions / role-based access).

Schema-level validation: While success cases assert "valid PriceList JSON object", there are no explicit schema validation tests against the API's PriceList definition (field presence, types, required fields, unexpected/missing fields).
Content negotiation and headers: Tests check content-type for success but don't verify other relevant headers (Content-Length, charset) or behavior with Accept headers.
Pagination-related performance/scalability semantics: no tests to confirm whether the API streams, truncates, or paginates when many price-list changes exist (beyond timing assertions).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: If the endpoint can return multiple items or could be affected by a large change history, add tests for page/limit/offset (and verify default/maximum page sizes) and behavior when requesting out-of-range pages.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: Verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers; add conditional GET tests using If-None-Match to assert 304 Not Modified behavior.
Add rate-limiting tests: Simulate high-frequency requests to assert 429 responses and presence of Retry-After header; verify graceful degradation under throttling.
Cover 403/permission scenarios: Add tests for valid authentication but insufficient authorization to ensure 403 is returned where applicable (role-based access).

Add strict schema validation tests: Validate the response body against the PriceList JSON schema (/definitions/PriceList) — required fields, types, nested structures, and reject responses that omit required attributes.
Test content negotiation and headers: Include cases with different Accept headers to confirm correct behavior and validate other response headers (charset, Content-Length when relevant).
Expand date-related edge cases: Add tests for time-zone/date-time inputs (if API later accepts datetimes), leap days, end-of-day boundaries, and future/past dates beyond business rules.

Clarify pagination vs aggregation behavior in spec: If API is intended to return a single PriceList (no paging), add an explicit test asserting no pagination-related headers are present; if it may return multiple results, implement pagination tests per above.
Document and automate negative large-input tests: Extend large payload and malformed parameter tests to include fuzzing and long-running requests to exercise parsing and boundary conditions.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/tags - Add tags to payment

covered_items: Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03) verify successful creation of tags with valid JSON arrays and required/optional headers, returning 201 and a JSON array of Tag objects.
Required Header Validation: TC01/TC03/TC07 explicitly test presence and absence of X-Killbill-CreatedBy and the expected error when missing.
Path Parameter Validation: TC06 checks invalid paymentId format (400) and TC05/TC18 cover non-existent paymentId (404).
Request Body Validation: TC08 (malformed JSON), TC09 (invalid tag UUID format), TC17 (nulls/partial elements), and TC10 (unexpected fields) cover a broad set of invalid payload cases.
Duplicate Handling / Idempotency: TC11 and TC19 validate duplicate UUIDs in the request and re-posting existing tags to avoid duplication.
Large/Boundary Payloads & Performance: TC14 (very large array) and TC12 (under load) address large payload and basic performance concerns.
Concurrency & Consistency: TC20 addresses concurrent requests and expects consistent, duplicate-free final state.
Dependency & Server Error Handling: TC13 models an upstream/tag-service unavailability and expects 503.
Security: TC15 (unauthorized user) and TC16 (malicious payload injection) cover basic auth and input-safety/security checks.
Empty Body Handling: TC04 covers an empty array and expects an empty JSON array response with 201.
gaps: Tag definition NOT FOUND: No explicit scenario where a well-formed tagDefinition UUID does not exist in the system (expected behavior not defined/tested — e.g., 404 or partial failure).

Partial/Transactional Behavior: No tests for mixed-case requests (some tag UUIDs valid/existing, others non-existent or invalid) to verify atomic vs. partial success semantics and the resulting rollback/partial-apply behavior.

Content-Type / Accept Headers and Unsupported Media Type: No tests verify request Content-Type requirements (application/json), response Content-Type, or behavior when using unsupported media types (eg. 415).

Response Schema / Contract Validation: Tests check presence of Tag objects but do not assert full schema details (field types, required metadata fields, response headers such as Content-Type, or Location header if applicable).
Server 500/Internal Error Simulation: TC13 covers 503 for tag service unavailability but there is no explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (e.g., DB failure) and rollback semantics.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: TC12 addresses performance under load but there are no focused tests for rate-limiting / throttling behavior (429 responses) or burst protection.
Caching / Headers (ETag, Cache-Control): No tests validate caching-related response headers.

Authorization Token Handling: TC15 checks an "unauthorized-user" header but there is no explicit test for missing/invalid auth token flows (401) vs. insufficient permissions (403) and role-based authorization checks.
Limits & Rejection Policies: No tests for enforcement of maximum allowed number of tags (if any limit exists) that should return a clear error (e.g., 413/4xx).
Concurrency determinism: TC20 calls out concurrency but does not define precise assertions for race conditions (e.g., which request wins, timing windows, DB uniqueness constraint failures).
recommendations: Add a scenario where tagDefinition UUIDs are well-formed but do not exist to assert expected behavior (404 for each missing tag or a transactional failure) and ensure the API documents which approach is used.
Add tests for mixed valid/invalid tag arrays to validate whether the operation is atomic or partial; assert transactional behavior and resulting state in DB.

Add explicit tests for Content-Type and Accept headers: successful request with Content-Type: application/json; requests with missing/incorrect Content-Type should return 415 (or documented error). Assert response Content-Type is application/json.

Add contract/schema tests that validate Tag object fields (types, required fields like paymentId, tagDefinitionId, createdBy, createdDate, metadata) and presence of response headers (Content-Type, possibly Location, and any request-tracking headers).
Introduce tests simulating 500-level failures (DB failure, unexpected server error) to verify 500 responses and how partial writes are handled or rolled back.
Add focused rate-limiting tests that send bursts of requests to validate 429 responses or throttling semantics; separate these from general performance/load tests.
Add caching-related tests if applicable for GET endpoints or any responses that could be cached — verify ETag/Cache-Control semantics where appropriate.
Add explicit authentication token tests: missing token, expired token, token with insufficient scope — assert clear 401 vs 403 behavior consistent with security policy.
Define and test limits: if there is a maximum allowed tags-per-request or per-entity, add tests to exercise the boundary and over-limit rejection.

For concurrency tests, make deterministic assertions: e.g., run N concurrent requests where some create the same tag and assert final DB state contains a single tag and that conflicting requests return consistent error codes if applicable.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Retrieve invoice item custom fields

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC05) exercise successful retrieval with valid invoiceItemId and audit parameter permutations (NONE/FULL/MINIMAL).
Empty Response: TC04 and TC17 verify behavior when there are no custom fields or when DB is empty (returns empty array or 404 as appropriate).
Path Parameter Validation: TC06 checks invalid UUID format and TC18 covers missing invoiceItemId path cases.
Resource Not Found: TC07 verifies 404 when a correctly formatted id does not exist.
Query Parameters: Tests cover valid audit values (TC02/TC03/TC05), invalid audit value (TC19), and behavior with extra unsupported params (TC11).
Authorization: TC08 checks unauthorized access (401).
Error & Dependency Handling: TC09, TC16, and TC20 cover service/unavailability, timeout and downstream dependency failures (503/504 scenarios).
Security: TC10 and TC21 test injection and XSS attempts in the path parameter.
Performance & Concurrency: TC12 and TC15 cover large payload and concurrent requests performance considerations.
Response Format: TC01/TC04/TC22 verify JSON response body and that fields are machine-readable; TC14 covers backward compatibility/Accept header usage.
gaps: Pagination: No tests verify pagination behavior or limit/offset handling for very large result sets (the spec hints at potentially large arrays but there are no pagination assertions).
Caching Behavior & Headers: No tests assert presence/semantics of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Content-Type / Produce Header: No explicit assertions that the response Content-Type is application/json and correct charset.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: There are concurrency/performance tests but no tests for rate limiting (429 responses) or API throttling behavior.
Authorization nuances: No tests for forbidden access (403) due to insufficient permissions / scopes (only 401 unauthenticated is present).
Schema Validation: Tests assert "JSON array of CustomField objects" but do not validate the structure/field types/required fields of the CustomField object against a schema.
Pagination performance edge-cases: While TC12 covers large volume, there is no test ensuring server enforces pagination limits or behaves properly if client requests huge page sizes.

Cache / Audit service interplay: While dependency failures are covered, there is no test validating partial availability (e.g., custom-fields available but audit service down when audit=MINIMAL behaves differently).
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: verify page/limit/offset parameters (or server default pagination) and behavior when number of custom fields exceeds a single page; include tests for client-requested large page sizes and server-enforced limits.
Add caching/conditional GET tests: assert ETag and Cache-Control headers, test If-None-Match to receive 304 where appropriate, and verify Last-Modified behavior if supported.
Assert content-type/produces header: add assertions that responses include Content-Type: application/json (and expected charset) and that non-JSON responses are not returned for this endpoint.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst of requests to ensure 429 responses or proper throttling headers when limits are exceeded.
Add authorization scope/permission tests: include scenarios where an authenticated user lacks permission (expect 403) and where credentials are expired/insufficient.
Add strict schema validation for CustomField objects: verify required fields, data types, and field constraints (e.g., id is UUID, name non-empty, fields present when audit=FULL).

Expand dependency interplay tests: validate behavior when audit service is partially degraded (e.g., audit=FULL requested but audit fields are unavailable) and document expected response shape/status.
Add negative and boundary tests for the audit query parameter (e.g., very long strings, unexpected case-sensitivity, leading/trailing whitespace) and validate error messages are descriptive.
Include tests that validate header-based content negotiation more broadly (e.g., unsupported Accept headers return 406 if applicable) and backward-compatibility constraints more explicitly.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Retrieve account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request: Core happy path is covered (TC01) and many valid query-parameter combinations are exercised (TC02-TC07, TC21, TC20).
Empty Response: Explicit test for accounts with no payment methods (TC08).
Query Parameters: withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit (FULL/MINIMAL), invalid audit, unexpected extra params, and combined parameters are covered (TC02-TC07, TC12, TC13, TC07).
Error Scenarios: Invalid accountId format and SQL-injection-like input covered (TC10, TC17) and account-not-found 404 is covered (TC09).
Authentication/Authorization (partial): Missing authentication token is tested (TC11) ensuring 401 responses.
Resilience & Integration: Service unavailable, dependency/plugin failures, retry/recovery, and timeouts are covered (TC15, TC16, TC19, TC22).
Security: XSS and SQL injection vectors for query/path parameters are included (TC17, TC18).
Large dataset/performance: Large number of payment methods and response-time assertion is present (TC14).
Regression/Compatibility: Regression and backward-compatibility scenarios present (TC20, TC21).
gaps: Pagination: No tests address pagination semantics, page size limits, offsets, or pagination headers even though a large dataset test exists (TC14 expects all items, but pagination behavior is not validated).
Caching Behavior / HTTP caching headers: No scenarios verify ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control, or conditional GET (304) behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for excessive request rates, 429 responses, or backoff behavior.
Authorization granularity: Only 401 (missing auth) is tested; 403 (authenticated but unauthorized) / role-based access controls are not covered.
Response Schema / Field-level validation: Tests assert "PaymentMethod objects" are returned but do not validate required fields, types, or JSON schema conformance for PaymentMethod objects.
Content-Type and headers: No explicit tests for Content-Type, pagination headers, or other HTTP response headers (e.g., Retry-After on 503).
Soft-delete semantics depth: includedDeleted=true is tested for inclusion but there is no assertion about deleted-flag semantics, timestamps, or how restoration/visibility behaves across endpoints.
Error payload format: While status codes are covered, the structure/fields of error responses (error codes, messages, localization) are not validated consistently.
Concurrency/race conditions: No tests for concurrent modifications or race conditions (e.g., payment method deleted between list and subsequent action).
Rate/Load performance beyond single large-case: Only one response-time check exists for >100 items; no sustained load or stress testing scenarios.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: create scenarios that assert pagination parameters (page, limit/offset) if supported, or validate that the API returns all items and/or explicit paging headers; include tests for large datasets with and without pagination to confirm behavior.
Add caching tests: verify presence and semantics of ETag/If-None-Match and Cache-Control/Expires headers, and that conditional GET returns 304 where appropriate.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate burst requests to validate 429 responses and Retry-After behavior; test client/backoff behavior.
Expand authorization tests: add 403 scenarios (authenticated but insufficient permissions) and tests for role-based access if applicable.

Add JSON schema/field-level assertions: validate that each PaymentMethod object contains required fields with correct types/constraints (e.g., id UUID, isDefault boolean, pluginInfo structure when requested).
Validate HTTP headers and error payload structure: assert Content-Type is application/json, and verify error response schema (code, message, parameters) for 4xx/5xx cases.
Deepen deleted semantics: test soft-delete behavior (deleted timestamp present, restored items visibility) and interactions between includedDeleted and other endpoints.
Add concurrency tests: simulate concurrent delete/update while listing to ensure consistent and documented behavior.
Add more performance/load tests: beyond single-case response-time check, run sustained load and measure throughput/latency percentiles.
Document expected behavior for unexpected/unknown query params: clarify whether they are ignored (as TC13 assumes) and add tests for unexpected but potentially harmful values.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered_items: Valid Deletion: Success scenarios for deleting all tags (no tagDef), deleting specific tagDef(s), and deleting when bundle has no tags (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC16).
Path param validation: Invalid bundleId format (400) and non-existent bundleId (404) are covered (TC05, TC06).

Query parameter validation: Invalid tagDef UUID, partial invalid/valid tagDef mix, empty array regression, extra unexpected query params, and very large numbers of tagDef values are covered (TC11, TC12, TC13, TC16, TC02).
Header validation & audit headers: Required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy being missing is tested; optional headers X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are exercised (TC03, TC08).
Concurrency & performance: Concurrency/race condition behavior and performance under many concurrent deletes and very large tag sets / timeout behavior are covered (TC15, TC18).
Integration & consistency: Post-deletion verification via GET to confirm persistence and consistency is included (TC17).
Error & availability handling: Service unavailable scenario (503) and unauthorized access (401) are covered (TC10, TC09).
Security/input sanitization: XSS/SQL injection in headers is considered (TC14).
gaps: Soft delete semantics: No test verifies whether tags are soft-deleted (marked deleted) vs permanently removed or that deleted records remain queryable via admin endpoints.
Server-side error handling (5xx) beyond 503 and timeout: There are no tests that simulate internal server errors (500) or database failures to verify graceful handling and consistent responses.
Produces / response headers: The story says "Produces: application/json" but tests do not assert response Content-Type, nor other relevant response headers (e.g., Audit-ID, Date).
Idempotency / repeated deletes: Although concurrency is tested, explicit idempotency of repeated DELETEs (delete same tag(s) multiple times sequentially) is not explicitly covered.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for rate limiting, throttling, or behavior when the API is hit rapidly beyond allowed quotas.
Caching behavior: No checks for caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache semantics for GET used in integration checks.

Authorization detail coverage: There is a negative unauthorized test (401) but no tests for forbidden (403) scenarios or for scoped permissions (different roles) to validate fine-grained authorization.
Boundary/error message assertions: Tests often assert status codes but many do not assert structured error payload contents (error codes, error type, machine-readable fields) or their schema.
Malformed query encoding & duplication: No tests for duplicated tagDef parameters, URL-encoded values, or malformed query string encodings.

Pagination / large-list handling in GET: While delete for large tag counts is tested, there are no tests covering pagination or how GET /bundles handles very large tag lists used in integration checks.
recommendations: Add a test that verifies soft-delete vs permanent-delete semantics: check the underlying tag storage (or admin read) to confirm whether records are flagged or removed.
Introduce server-error simulations (500) and database-failure tests to ensure the API returns consistent error responses and does not leave data in an inconsistent state.
Assert response headers: add assertions for Content-Type (application/json) and any audit or caching headers returned by the DELETE and subsequent GET calls.
Add explicit idempotency tests: sequentially call DELETE twice for the same tag set and assert first returns 204 and second also returns 204 (or documented behavior).
Add rate-limiting tests: check behavior when exceeding request quotas (429) or how the system throttles burst traffic.
Add tests for authorization scopes/roles and 403 Forbidden scenarios in addition to 401, to validate permission boundaries.
Enrich error-response assertions: validate structure and content of error responses (message, code, field, etc.) for 4xx and 5xx cases.
Cover malformed and duplicated query parameters and URL-encoded tagDef values to ensure robust parsing of the tagDef multi-valued parameter.
Include caching and pagination checks for GET integration calls (ETag, Cache-Control) and validate that large tag lists are returned/paginated correctly when used for verification.
Add a test to verify behaviour when duplicate tagDef values are supplied and when tagDef values include whitespace or mixed-case UUIDs to validate normalization rules.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Retrieve account invoice payments

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios (TC01-TC06, TC16, TC20) validate successful retrieval for required path parameter and combinations of query parameters.
Empty Response: TC07 and TC17 cover behavior when an account has no invoice payments (empty JSON array).

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage for withPluginInfo, withAttempts, pluginProperty (single/multiple), audit (FULL, MINIMAL), unsupported audit value (TC12), unexpected extra params (TC13), and combined parameter interactions (TC06).
Path Parameter Validation: TC08 validates malformed UUID handling (400).
Resource Existence: TC09 validates account-not-found behavior (404).
Authorization: TC10 covers missing/invalid authentication token (401).
Error Handling / Service Unavailability: TC11 covers 503 service down; TC18 covers dependent-service failures and partial data/warnings.
Security: TC23 and TC24 cover SQL injection and XSS attempts for accountId and pluginProperty inputs.
Edge Cases: TC14 (max pluginProperty), TC15 (very large dataset), TC21/TC22 (performance under normal/peak loads), TC25 (transient network retry) cover many edge and non-functional scenarios.
Regression & Compatibility: TC19 and TC20 provide regression and backward-compatibility checks.
Response Content: Several scenarios assert response is application/json and that InvoicePayment objects include required fields and optional sections when requested.
gaps: Pagination specifics: Although TC15 mentions large datasets and possible pagination, there are no explicit tests for pagination parameters (limit/offset/page token), boundary conditions (page size = 1, page size = max), or correctness of paginated responses (links, total counts).
Caching behavior: No tests check caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Rate limiting / Throttling: No scenarios validate rate limiting behavior (429 responses) or client/backoff handling for many rapid requests.
Authorization nuance/permissions: Tests cover missing/invalid token (401) but do not cover insufficient privileges (403) or role-based access control differences.

Query parameter validation variants: Missing tests for malformed boolean query values (e.g., withPluginInfo=notBoolean), malformed pluginProperty formats beyond XSS (e.g., missing "=" or empty values), and too-long pluginProperty entries.
Schema-level validation: Tests assert "required payment fields" but do not enumerate/validate types/formats of specific InvoicePayment fields (dates, amounts, UUIDs) or strict contract changes.
Response headers and MIME: Although Background states application/json, there are no assertions for Content-Type, charset, or other headers (e.g., paging-related headers).

Partial-data semantics and filtering logic: It is not explicitly covered whether pluginProperty filtering is AND vs OR for multiple properties, nor is there verification of matching logic (exact match vs contains vs key-only).

Negative boolean/enum combinations: No tests for combinations of unsupported query parameter combinations (e.g., withPluginInfo=true&withAttempts=invalid, or audit omitted default behavior verification for each enum), or for duplicate query param values and their interpreted precedence.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: include limit/offset or page token queries, verify page sizes, boundary conditions, total counts (if provided), and correct ordering across pages. Test also conditional GET and paginated response headers (Link, X-Total-Count) if applicable.
Add caching tests: validate ETag and Cache-Control headers, test conditional GETs using If-None-Match to receive 304, and verify cache-related responses under repeated requests.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to validate 429 responses and test client-side retry/backoff handling.
Extend authorization tests: add scenarios for insufficient privileges (403), role-based access differences, and token-expiry behavior.
Add strict schema validation tests: assert data types/formats for InvoicePayment fields (UUIDs, ISO dates, numeric amounts, enum values) and check contract stability for legacy clients.

Add validation tests for query parameter value types and malformed inputs: e.g., withPluginInfo=abc, withAttempts=123, pluginProperty missing "=", excessively long values, and duplicate param handling.
Clarify and test pluginProperty semantics: add tests that verify whether multiple pluginProperty parameters use AND or OR logic and verify matching rules (exact vs partial).
Add tests for response headers: Content-Type, charset, caching headers, and any custom headers (request-id, rate-limit headers).
Add negative performance/regression tests for very large result sets including both "return all" (if supported) and paginated responses to validate memory and latency guarantees.
If applicable, add tests for 4xx/5xx escalation paths around downstream failures (detailed error payload structure) and for graceful degradation when dependent services intermittently fail.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/pagination - List accounts

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios validate successful retrieval with default and explicit parameters (TC01, TC02, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC25, TC28, TC43).
Empty Response: Scenarios for no accounts and offset beyond available data ensure empty-array handling (TC08, TC09).
Pagination: Numerous tests cover pagination behavior, boundaries and large-data pagination (TC02, TC19, TC21, TC27, TC31, TC46, TC48).

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of combinations and individual params (offset, limit, accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit) including malformed and invalid values (TC03, TC04, TC07, TC26, TC38, TC39, TC13).
