Authorization: Unauthorized and invalid-token cases are present (TC15, TC16).
Error Handling / Status Codes: Tests for invalid params (400), method not allowed (405), service unavailable (503), timeouts, and dependency failures are included (TC10-TC13, TC17, TC18, TC40, TC32).
Security: Injection and XSS attempts are tested (TC23, TC24).
Concurrency & Performance: Concurrent request behavior and a large-volume performance scenario are present (TC20, TC19).
Integration & Recovery: Dependency availability and recovery tests for balance and audit services are present (TC32, TC33, TC37).

Edge Cases & Combinations: Wide set of edge cases—missing params, extra params, max/min values, boolean permutations, partial datasets, malformed inputs, and retry scenarios—are covered (TC14, TC29, TC30, TC34-TC36, TC41, TC42, TC44-TC50).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching-related headers or behavior (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified), nor conditional GET handling.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No scenarios exercise rate limiting, burst traffic, or 429 responses.

Content-Type and Schema Validation: No explicit checks for response Content-Type (application/json) or strict JSON schema validation of the Account object (required fields, types beyond presence/absence of a few fields).

Default Parameter Semantics: While defaults are assumed in tests, there is no explicit assertion that default offset=0 and default limit=100 are enforced by the API (e.g., comparing result sizes to the exact default limit).

Conflicting-parameter semantics: No test for semantics when accountWithBalanceAndCBA=true but accountWithBalance=false (how conflicts are resolved), or when parameters are mutually redundant or contradictory.
Authorization granularity: Tests cover 401 unauthorized, but not 403 forbidden or role-based access control scenarios.
Caching / Conditional Requests: No tests for client-side caching/conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 Not Modified).
Response Headers: Aside from status and body, tests do not assert other important headers (Content-Length, pagination-related headers if any, or security headers).
Rate-limited concurrency: Concurrency tests do not include high-frequency bursts to reveal throttling/rate-limit behavior.
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify Cache-Control and ETag headers, conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match -> 304), and any server-side caching semantics.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate high request rates to validate 429 responses, backoff headers (Retry-After), and graceful degradation.
Add strict response schema validation: assert Content-Type: application/json and validate full Account JSON schema (required fields, types, nested objects) for representative scenarios.
Explicitly test default parameter enforcement: assert that no-parameter requests behave exactly as offset=0 and limit=100 (including when database contains >100 accounts).
Add tests for conflicting parameters: e.g., accountWithBalanceAndCBA=true with accountWithBalance=false to define and assert documented precedence/behavior.
Cover authorization granularity: add tests for 403/role-based access to ensure different credentials/roles receive appropriate responses.
Assert important headers: add checks for pagination-related headers (if applicable), Content-Length, security headers (e.g., CSP, X-Content-Type-Options) and any custom headers the API should return.
Extend concurrency tests to include burst/rate-limit behavior: combine TC20 with high-frequency requests to observe throttling and stability under sustained load.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01-TC04, TC05, TC06, TC21, TC22) verify successful refresh flows including optional query params and headers.
Query Parameters: pluginName and pluginProperty single/multi-value handling is covered (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC07, TC21).
Path parameter validation: Invalid UUID format and excessively long IDs are tested (TC08, TC19).
Non-Existing Resource: 404 when account not found and empty-database case are covered (TC09, TC27).
Required Headers / Authorization: Presence and absence of required header X-Killbill-CreatedBy and authentication token tests are included (TC05, TC10, TC15).
Error responses for external dependencies: External gateway / plugin availability and timeout scenarios are covered (TC13, TC20, TC25).
Security validations: SQL injection and XSS attempts in pluginName/pluginProperty are included (TC16, TC17).
Performance & Concurrency: Concurrent requests and heavy-load scenarios covered (TC23, TC14, TC29).
Large payloads and many pluginProperty values: Stress/size scenarios included (TC07, TC24).
Edge cases and robustness: Extra unexpected parameters, malformed pluginProperty, and encoding/regression checks are present (TC12, TC18, TC21).
Data consistency / integration: Post-refresh consistency across systems is tested (TC26).
gaps: Produces / Response body & headers: The story indicates "Produces: application/json" but tests do not assert response content-type, content-length, or the semantics of 204 (no body) vs application/json.
Exact error message/structure validation: Many error scenarios assert status codes but do not assert standardized error payload format or specific error codes/messages consistently.
Authorization role vs authentication: Tests cover missing/invalid token (401) but do not verify role-based access control or 403 Forbidden scenarios.
Validation of optional header values: X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are exercised as presence but not validated for allowed formats/lengths or encoding.
Audit/logging side-effects: No tests validate that X-Killbill-CreatedBy (audit) is recorded in logs or persisted audit fields.
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limits or behavior under high-frequency request bursts beyond concurrency/performance checks.
Caching / HTTP semantics: No tests for caching-related headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or behavior when cached responses might apply.
Idempotency / duplicate requests: No explicit tests for duplicate/ repeated refresh requests and how duplicates are handled.
Error payload consistency for dependency failures: While status codes for gateway/plugin failure are covered, the error body format and retries/backoff behavior are not validated.
Partial update semantics & request body handling: Story indicates no request body; tests do not validate how unexpected request bodies are handled (ignored/rejected).
recommendations: Add assertions for HTTP response headers and content-type: explicitly assert Content-Type, Content-Length, and behavior of 204 (no body) vs documented application/json.
Validate error payload structure and messages: for 400/404/502/503/401/422 responses assert JSON error schema and human-readable message to ensure clients can parse errors reliably.
Add role-based authorization tests: include scenarios that produce 403 Forbidden when authentication is valid but the caller lacks privileges.

Test optional header validation and audit recording: verify acceptable length/encoding for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment and that X-Killbill-CreatedBy is persisted in audit logs or change history.
Introduce rate limiting / throttling tests: simulate burst traffic and verify 429 or appropriate throttling behaviour and graceful degradation.
Add caching and HTTP semantics tests if applicable: check for ETag/Cache-Control or confirm caching is not applied for this endpoint.
Add idempotency/duplicate call tests: send repeated identical requests to verify no duplicate side-effects and that operation is safe/repeatable.
Assert behavior on unexpected request body: send a request with a body and verify the service either ignores it or returns a clear 4xx indicating body is not allowed.
Standardize dependency-failure response checks: for gateway/plugin failures assert standard error codes, retry hints or headers (Retry-After), and consistent error payloads.
Add negative/limit tests for header and query param sizes and encodings (very long pluginName, extreme pluginProperty count) to define and enforce limits.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered_items: Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) validate successful creation and returned 201 with JSON array of created CustomField objects.
Required and optional headers: Tests cover the required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header and optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment (TC01, TC02, TC09).
Malformed/invalid payloads: Malformed JSON (TC08) and missing required CustomField properties (TC16) are tested.
Input validation for paymentId: Invalid format (TC10) and non-existent paymentId (TC11) are tested, covering 400 and 404 cases from the story.
Authentication/Authorization: Unauthorized or missing auth token scenario (TC12) and missing required header (TC09) are present.
Edge cases and robustness: Empty array (TC07), extra/unexpected fields (TC06), SQL/XSS injection attempts (TC14), and very large payloads (TC15) are included.
Service error handling: Dependent service / DB down scenario is covered (TC13 -> 503).
Concurrency & duplicate/edge behavior: Concurrent requests (TC19) and duplicate field-name regression (TC20) are covered.
Unicode and internationalization: Unicode characters handling is covered (TC21).
Performance & SLA: Normal and peak load performance tests are included (TC22, TC23).
Integration and persistence: Post + subsequent GET persistence check and cross-system consistency tests are included (TC24, TC25).
Documentation/accessibility: API docs accessibility scenario is present (TC26).
gaps: Content-Type validation: No explicit scenario for missing or incorrect Content-Type header (e.g., not application/json) and expected 415/400 behaviour is not covered.
Non-array JSON body: No explicit test for a well-formed JSON that is not an array (e.g., object instead of array) which should be validated as invalid per schema.
Invalid field data types / value validation: Tests cover missing fields but not explicit invalid types for CustomField properties (e.g., non-string fieldName/fieldValue or invalid objectType).
Exact objectType and field constraints: No test asserting the expected objectType value (e.g., that objectType corresponds to invoice payment) or constraints on allowed fieldName patterns/lengths.
Duplicate submission / idempotency: No test that retries identical requests (duplicate submission) to verify idempotency or deduplication handling.
Internal server error (500): Only 503 is simulated; a generic 500 Internal Server Error case and the API’s behavior/response body for unexpected server failures are not covered.
Response headers and content-type: No tests assert response Content-Type or other headers (e.g., Location, ETag, or custom headers) on success or error.

Behavior for adding fields that collide with existing field names across separate requests: TC04 ensures existing fields remain unchanged, but there is no explicit test for the behavior when adding a field with the same name as an existing one in a subsequent request (whether it creates a duplicate or errors).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for how the API handles excessive request rates (429) or throttling under stress.

Ambiguity-handling tests: Several scenarios use "201 or 400/413" etc.; the tests do not assert a single expected behavior for these ambiguous cases. The API spec should be clarified and tests made deterministic.
recommendations: Add a test for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., Content-Type: text/plain) expecting appropriate error (415 or 400) so clients get clear guidance when they send wrong media types.
Add a test sending a valid JSON object (not array) as the request body and assert a 400 with a clear schema validation error.
Add tests for invalid data types inside CustomField objects (non-string fieldName/fieldValue, invalid enum/objectType) to ensure schema validation is enforced.
Add assertions verifying that the returned CustomField.objectType is the expected value (e.g., invoicePayment) and any constraints on fieldName/fieldValue (length, allowed characters).
Introduce duplicate-submission tests (replay same request) to verify idempotency/deduplication behavior and ensure duplicates aren’t unintentionally created.
Simulate a generic 500 Internal Server Error and verify that the API surfaces a consistent error response to clients (and that metrics/alerts would trigger).
Add tests asserting response headers (Content-Type: application/json and any relevant headers) for both success and error responses.

Add a test for adding a custom field with the same name as an existing field in a subsequent request and assert expected behavior (duplicate allowed vs. rejected) — clarify API behaviour in the spec and codify in tests.
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests to validate 429 responses or graceful degradation under extreme load.
Remove ambiguous "201 or 400/413" expectations by updating the API specification with definitive behaviour, then make tests deterministic (explicit expected status codes and response shapes).

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/catalog/simplePlan - Add a simple plan entry in the current version of the catalog

covered_items: Valid Payload: Successful creation scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC19, TC20, TC21, TC23) validate resource creation with valid payloads and variations.
Invalid Payload: Multiple negative tests (TC04 missing fields, TC05 invalid currency, TC08 empty body, TC09 malformed JSON, TC18 XSS/SQL patterns) cover input validation and malformed payloads.
Required / Optional Headers: Presence and absence of X-Killbill-CreatedBy is tested (TC01, TC03) and optional headers X-Killbill-Reason / X-Killbill-Comment are exercised (TC02).
Duplicate Submission / Conflicts: Duplicate planId handling is covered (TC06).
Large Payloads: Very large payload handling is considered (TC15).
Concurrency: Concurrent creation scenarios are covered (TC22).
Integration / Service Availability: Dependent service success and degraded/unavailable states are covered (TC11, TC23, TC24) and a retry-after-network-failure scenario is present (TC16).
Method Validation: Unsupported HTTP method is covered (TC14).
Performance: Response time assertion is included (TC17).
Schema tolerance: Extra/unsupported fields tolerated case is covered (TC07).
gaps: Internal Server Errors (500): No explicit tests simulate backend failures (database exceptions, unhandled server errors) to verify 500 handling and safe rollback.
Content-Type / Request Headers Validation: No tests validate behavior when Content-Type is missing/incorrect (Consumes: application/json) or when request uses wrong media type.
Response Headers & Content Negotiation: Tests do not assert response Content-Type, Location header (if applicable), or that the response body is exactly a string versus JSON envelope.
Authorization edge cases: Only "missing authentication" -> 401 is present (TC10). There are no tests for invalid credentials, expired tokens, or role/permission-related forbidden responses (403).

Duplicate submission idempotency semantics: TC06 checks existing planId conflict but there is no explicit test for repeated submission of same request (e.g., identical POST retried) to validate idempotency/duplicate-submission handling beyond planId conflict.

Invalid Data Types / Boundary numeric validation: While currency and missing fields are covered, there are no explicit tests for wrong data types (e.g., strings for numeric fields), out-of-range numeric values, or malformed enums beyond currency code.

Atomicity and partial-failure rollback: Given the story warns it modifies the live catalog, there are no tests verifying atomicity when partial failures occur (e.g., catalog updated but dependent service failed).
Rate limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting, throttling, or how burst requests are handled.
Security headers / audit logging verification: Tests do not verify that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted in audit logs or reflected in the catalog change history.
recommendations: Add tests that simulate backend failures (database exceptions, unexpected server errors) and assert 500 Internal Server Error behavior and safe rollback or compensation actions.
Add tests for Content-Type handling: requests with missing or incorrect Content-Type header should be exercised and validated (expect 400 or 415 as designed).
Assert response headers and media type: add checks for response Content-Type, and if applicable Location header, and confirm response body type (string vs JSON) matches the API contract.
Expand authentication tests: include invalid or expired credentials (expect 401) and role/permission-based forbidden cases (403) to cover authorization nuances.
Add idempotency/duplicate-submission scenarios: test repeated identical POSTs (retries) to confirm how duplicates are handled and document expected behavior (409 vs 400 vs idempotent success).
Cover data-type and numeric boundaries: add tests that submit wrong data types for fields (e.g., amount as string), out-of-range amounts, and invalid enums to improve validation coverage.

Test atomicity when dependent services fail: ensure either the catalog change is fully rolled back or documented behavior is asserted when integration with downstream/dependent services fails mid-operation.
Add rate-limiting and throttling tests to validate behavior under bursts and ensure the API returns appropriate status codes (e.g., 429) if limits exist.
Include tests that verify audit/logging of the X-Killbill-* headers are persisted or surfaced as part of the change history, since the story stresses live-catalog modifications.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple positive scenarios (TC01–TC06, TC27–TC33) verify successful retrieval and combinations of query parameters (accountWithBalance, accountWithBalanceAndCBA, audit).
Empty Response / Not Found: TC07 and TC08 cover "no data" and non-existent accountId (404).
Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of query parameter combinations including valid/invalid values, missing booleans, unsupported audit values, and combinations (TC02–TC06, TC23–TC25, TC27–TC33).
Authorization: Missing and invalid token flows are covered (TC10, TC11) producing 401 responses.
Input Validation & Error Handling: Invalid accountId format and injection/XSS payloads covered (TC09, TC13, TC14) producing 400; unsupported audit value covered (TC25).
Service/Platform Errors & Timeouts: Service-unavailable and timeout/heavy-load behaviors are considered (TC12, TC16, TC20) including 503/504 expectations.
Security & Robustness: Injection and XSS tests (TC13, TC14), plus no-sensitive-data leakage requirement, are included.
Performance/Scaling & Concurrency: Large payload and concurrent request scenarios included (TC17, TC18).
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Regression test for prior bug (TC22) and backward compatibility scenario (TC19) are present.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests assert caching headers or conditional GET behavior (ETag, Cache-Control, If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No scenarios to validate API rate limits, quota exhaustion, or 429 responses.
Response Headers / Content-Type: Tests do not validate Content-Type (application/json) or other relevant headers (e.g., Content-Length, correlation IDs).
500 Internal Server Error / Unexpected Server Failures: There is a 503 test, but no explicit test asserting 500 behavior or recovery from persistent server-side exceptions.
Authorization depth: 403 / permission-based access is not covered (only 401 for auth token issues). Role-based access or token scopes are not tested.
HTTP Method Handling: No tests verify disallowed methods (e.g., POST/PUT/DELETE returning 405) for this endpoint.

Schema / Contract Validation: There are checks for presence/absence of some fields but no explicit JSON Schema / contract validation to ensure the Account object exactly matches the documented schema.
Caching / Conditional retrieval edge cases: No tests for stale/If-Modified-Since behavior or validating caching semantics for frequently requested resources.
recommendations: Add caching and conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, and behavior for If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since (expect 304 where applicable).
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate many requests in a short window to assert 429 responses and proper Retry-After headers, and verify graceful degradation.
Validate response headers and content-type: assert Content-Type=application/json and required headers (correlation id, Content-Length when relevant).
Add 500/Internal server error tests: simulate server exceptions or DB failures to verify 500 behavior and proper error payloads (and recovery/alerts).
Cover authorization depth: add tests for 403 forbidden scenarios (valid token but insufficient permissions or scope), and test token expiry/refresh flows.
HTTP method correctness: add negative tests to ensure unsupported methods return 405 and include Allow header.
Add JSON Schema / contract checks: validate the full Account object against the OpenAPI/JSON Schema definition (fields, types, required properties).

Clarify pagination applicability: if retrieving a single resource makes pagination irrelevant, mark pagination as N/A in acceptance criteria; otherwise, add tests for pagination when endpoint is extended to list operations.
Add fuzzing and boundary tests for query parameter values (very long strings, unexpected unicode), and bolt-on negative tests for combined invalid parameters.

Add automated performance/load tests covering sustained concurrent requests and verify SLA for response times under load; formalize expectations for 200 vs 206 behavior when dependent services return partial/stale data.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoices - Retrieve account invoices

covered_items: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC20) verify successful 200 responses for valid account requests and combinations of query parameters.
Empty Response: TC08 and TC25 validate handling of accounts with no invoices and filters that yield no results (empty JSON array).

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of query parameters (startDate, endDate, withMigrationInvoices, unpaidInvoicesOnly, includeVoidedInvoices, audit) including combined usage and edge cases (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC23, TC24).

Error Handling / Input Validation: Scenarios for malformed accountId (TC10), non-existent account (TC11), invalid/attack-like inputs (TC15, TC27), invalid date ranges (TC21), and extremely large accountId (TC26) cover many validation and error paths (400/404/422).
Authorization: Authentication-related failures are tested (TC12 missing token, TC13 invalid token) producing 401 responses.
Performance & Resilience: Large-volume performance (TC16), downstream slowness/timeout (TC17), concurrency (TC18), and integration inconsistency handling (TC28) are present.
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Regression checks for filters and no-query-parameter behavior (TC19, TC20) and accessibility/integration documentation check (TC29) are included.
gaps: Pagination: No explicit tests for pagination semantics (page size, page number/offset, Link headers or next/prev, or correctness of paginated slices). TC16 mentions potential pagination but does not validate pagination behavior or headers.
Caching Behavior / HTTP Headers: Missing checks for caching-related headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control, Vary) and conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match/304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No scenarios that verify behavior under API rate limits (429 responses, Retry-After handling).
Authorization nuance (403): No test for authenticated but unauthorized access (403) or role/permission based access control.
Response Schema & Content-Type: Tests assert "Invoice objects" are returned but do not validate the invoice JSON schema fields, types, content-type header, or error payload formats in detail.
Pagination performance tradeoffs: No tests for server behavior on very large pages (e.g., requesting huge page size), or for stream/partial response handling.

Malformed query formats (non-injection): Apart from injection/XSS, there are no tests for invalid date formats (e.g., startDate=20230101), boolean param malformed values (unpaidInvoicesOnly=notabool), or unsupported enum values for audit beyond FULL/MINIMAL/NONE.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: cover query parameters for page/offset/limit or whatever pagination the API exposes; assert Link headers or next/prev tokens; validate correctness of items per page and total counts.
Add caching and conditional GET tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers, and test If-None-Match/304 behavior to ensure proper caching semantics.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to validate 429 responses and Retry-After behavior, and ensure graceful degradation.
Add 403/authorization scope tests: validate scenarios where a token is valid but lacks permissions and should receive 403, and include role-based access checks if applicable.

Add strict response schema validation: assert required Invoice fields, data types, date formats, currency/amount fields, and content-type application/json; include negative tests for schema violations returned by downstream services.

Expand input-validation tests for query params: add tests for malformed dates (invalid formats), invalid boolean values, invalid enum values for audit, and ensure the API returns consistent 400/422 errors with clear messages.
Enhance performance/pagination edge tests: verify behavior when requesting very large page sizes, confirm server enforces maximums, and test streaming/partial responses if supported.
Add tests for header-related behaviors: Content-Type, Accept header negotiation, and any CORS headers if relevant to clients.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/payments/{paymentId}/transactions/{paymentTransactionId} - Update existing paymentTransaction and associated payment state

covered_items: PUT - Valid Request: Successful update scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC23) verify expected 204 behavior and DB update.
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 cases for missing payment/transaction and empty DB (TC06, TC07, TC12).
PUT - Input Validation: Invalid ID formats, malformed JSON, missing body, and inconsistent state checks covered (TC04, TC05, TC08, TC09, TC10).
PUT - Headers: Required header missing case (X-Killbill-CreatedBy) and optional headers presence/combination/whitespace variations covered (TC03, TC02, TC24, TC26).
PUT - Concurrency: Concurrent update scenario and final-state consistency (TC17).
Error / Resilience: Backend timeout and degraded dependency behaviors are considered (TC16, TC22).
Security: SQL injection and XSS payload tests are included (TC18, TC19).
Edge cases / Limits: Maximum and minimum allowed field values covered (TC14, TC15).
Robustness: Extra/unsupported request-body fields and extra query parameters are explicitly tested (TC13, TC25).
Authentication/Authorization: Unauthorized request returns 401 (TC11).
Regression/Performance: Regression scenario for previously problematic state and high-load performance test included (TC20, TC21).
Accessibility/Documentation: API docs accessibility check is present (TC28).
gaps: Partial Update semantics: The guidelines ask to verify partial updates are rejected unless allowed. Tests include a "partial input" success (TC23) but there is no explicit scenario asserting that disallowed partial updates are rejected or clarifying allowed partial-update policy.
Duplicate submission / Idempotency: No tests for handling duplicate/ replayed PUT requests or idempotency guarantees.

Server Internal Errors (5xx) and DB failure modes: While timeouts and degraded dependencies are present, explicit 500 Internal Server Error behavior (e.g., DB failure, unexpected exceptions) and how the API surfaces them is not tested.
Rate limiting / throttling: High-load performance is present (TC21) but there are no tests that assert rate-limiting, throttling or back-pressure behavior (e.g., 429 responses).
Content-Type / Accept headers: No tests ensure requests with missing/incorrect Content-Type or Accept headers are handled consistently.
Authorization scope/roles: There is an unauthorized (401) test, but no test asserting forbidden (403) behavior for authenticated non-admin roles or token with insufficient privileges.
Audit/logging and headers validation: The story requires X-Killbill-CreatedBy; audit side-effects (audit record created, creator recorded) are not verified.
Atomicity / Transactional integrity: No tests for rollback semantics if update partially fails (e.g., payment state updated but transaction not), or multi-table consistency on failure.

Schema/type validation depth: While invalid state / malformed JSON are covered, there are no explicit tests for type mismatches for each important field (e.g., numeric vs string), or boundary numeric overflow tests beyond max-length strings.
Id cross-ownership mismatch nuance: TC27 covers mismatched payment/transaction cross-reference, but more variations (transaction exists but linked to another tenant/account) are not covered.
recommendations: Add explicit partial-update policy tests: one scenario that asserts partial updates are accepted (if allowed) and another that asserts they are rejected with 400 when they are not permitted. Document expected behavior in acceptance criteria before implementing tests.
Add duplicate-submission/idempotency tests: send the same PUT twice and verify idempotent behavior or appropriate conflict handling.
Include 500 Internal Server Error simulations: e.g., force DB exception and verify API returns 500 with safe error payload and does not leak internals.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests: validate 429 responses or degraded behavior when request rates exceed configured limits, and ensure the system recovers gracefully.
Validate Content-Type/Accept handling: test missing or incorrect Content-Type and Accept headers and ensure consistent error codes (e.g., 415/406 or 400 per API contract).
Add authorization scope tests: include authenticated non-admin (403 Forbidden) and token-scoped access checks to ensure only admins can perform this operation.

Verify audit/logging side-effects: test that X-Killbill-CreatedBy (and optional reason/comment) are recorded in audit logs / DB audit tables with correct values and trimming behavior for whitespace variants.
Add transactional/atomicity tests: simulate partial failures (e.g., update touches multiple tables) and assert rollback or compensating behavior to preserve consistency.
Expand schema/type validation tests: include field-level type mismatch cases and numeric boundary/overflow tests beyond max-length strings.
Extend cross-ownership tests: verify behavior when transaction belongs to another payment, another account, or another tenant (multi-tenant isolation).
Add tests for large payloads and size limits (beyond TC14): ensure very large payloads are handled or rejected gracefully (413 / 400) and do not cause resource exhaustion.

results.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/admin/queues - Get queues entries

covered_items: Valid Request: Many success scenarios cover default behaviour and individual query parameters (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC10, TC23).
Empty Response: Covered (TC11, TC29) to verify empty dataset and filters that exclude all data.

Query Parameters & Validation: Extensive coverage for parameters including accountId format/not-found (TC13, TC14), queueName, serviceName, minDate/maxDate, boolean flags (withHistory, withInProcessing, withBusEvents, withNotifications) and combinations (TC06-TC09, TC10, TC24, TC25).
Error Handling: Major error responses are covered (400 invalid input TC13/TC25, 404 account not found TC14, 500 internal error TC30, 503 service unavailable TC16, 504 timeout TC19).
Security & Input Sanitization: Injection and XSS attempts are considered (TC17, TC26).
Operational / Robustness: Large volume and performance expectation (TC18), concurrent requests (TC20), retry/recovery (TC27), timeout and transient failures (TC19, TC16).
Authorization: Unauthorized access scenario covered (TC15).
Backward compatibility & Regression: Regression for withHistory and backward compatibility checks included (TC21, TC22).
Accessibility / Docs: API documentation and consistent error schema scenario included (TC28).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios verify pagination/streaming controls (page size, offsets, next links) or retrieving large datasets in pages — TC18 asserts a large dataset but does not test pagination behavior.
Caching Behavior: No tests check cache-related headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET semantics.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting (429) or throttling behavior under rapid repeated requests; concurrent requests (TC20) are covered but not rate-limiting policies.
Authorization granularity: Only 401 unauthorized is tested (TC15). Missing tests for 403 (authenticated but insufficient privileges) and role-based access control variations.

Response Schema & Content Validation: Response is asserted as application/octet-stream in TC01, but there are no tests that validate the exact binary/stream format, schema of entries, or that confirm the stream can be parsed/decoded into expected structures.
Parameter boundary and combinatorial edge-cases: Missing tests for invalid boolean formats (e.g., withHistory=notabool), minDate > maxDate, extremely long strings, and combined invalid parameters.
Pagination-performance interaction: No tests for retrieving large datasets with pagination to ensure performance and correctness across pages (e.g., consistency, duplicates, missing items).
Caching + Authorization interaction: No tests for how caching headers behave for authenticated/admin-only endpoints (sensitive data shouldn’t be cached publicly).
recommendations: Add pagination tests: cover page size limits, offsets or cursor-based paging, next/prev links, and verify full dataset can be retrieved by iterating pages. Include tests for when page parameters are invalid.
Introduce caching tests: validate ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers, conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since), and ensure caching does not leak sensitive admin data.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate burst traffic to verify 429 responses, Retry-After header behavior, and that legitimate retries succeed after backoff.
Expand authorization tests: add 403 scenarios (authenticated but insufficient privileges), role-based checks, and test token expiration / malformed tokens.

Validate response schema and stream contents: add tests that decode the application/octet-stream payload and assert the entries structure, fields, and types (including verifying no malformed entries).

Edge-case parameter validation: add tests for malformed booleans, minDate > maxDate, extreme string lengths, and invalid combinations of parameters to ensure robust 400 responses and clear error messages.
Combine pagination with large-data performance: test retrieving a large dataset via pagination and assert acceptable response times per page and overall completeness/consistency.
Add tests for caching + auth interplay: ensure responses with sensitive content are marked appropriately (no public caching) and conditional requests behave correctly for admin endpoints.
